loans.name: Abdella

texts.en:
Abdella is a 37-year-old business man, who lives in Juba. He is married and has two children between the ages of one and seven. The children go to school. 

Abdella runs a cosmetics store business, and he has been in the business for two years. He has no employees. Abdella heard about Finance Sudan through the outreach and promotion done by the loan officers. He is taking a loan of 2,000 to purchase more cosmetics like, Caro light, Rubbi, and many others. In addition to this business, Abdella has no other source of income. 

In five years time, Abdella would like to hope for an increase in the business and in sales in the shop.

His major challenge is only the competitors, but he says, "We shall compete with them."

Abdella says that he and his friends have a lot of thankfulness to Finance Sudan for helping them start up their own business.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics

loans.name: Agostino

texts.en:
Agostino has operated his electronics sales and repair shop in Olkalau town for the last 11 years. He is 40 years old, married to Catherine, and they have two school-going children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy more stocks of television sets and radios for sale in his business.

In the future, Agostino hopes to expand his electronics shop to wholesale and become the best electronics dealer in the region, thereby improving the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy more television sets and radios for sale

loans.name: Hezron

texts.en:
Hezron has practiced farming in Olkalau town for the last 12 years.  He is 46 years old, married to Hannah, and they have two school-going children.  Besides farming as his primary activity, he also buys cereals which he sells in the area.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy tomato seeds and also for labor purposes.

In the future, Hezron hopes to buy more land for farming and increase his income, thereby improving his family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy tomato seeds and for labor purposes

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en:
Gabriel has worked in the transport industry in Olkalau Town for the last four years.  He is 28 years old, married to Miriam, and together they have two school-going children.  Gabriel is also a farmer.

Gabriel was introduced to Kiva field partner KADET LTD by one of our field loan officers, and this will be his third loan. He paid back all his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use the proceeds of this loan to buy potato seedlings and fertilizer. He also plans to use part of this loan to pay for  motorbike maintenance.

In future, Gabriel wants to invest more in his transport business by buying a passenger service vehicle, and hopes to become one of the leading businessmen in the Olkalau area.

loans.use: to pay for motorcycle maintenance and to buy potato seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Farrah

texts.en:
Farrah is 34, married, and has five children that range in age from 4 to 15 years old.  His wife is a trader, and all of their children attend school.  In 2000, Farrah established a furniture-making business.  He began his business at age 15, after his father died.  Without his father, there was no sponsorship for his schooling and because of this, Farrah's uncle advised his mother to send him to study at a carpentry workshop.

Now Farrah makes beds, chairs, cupboards, dressing mirror, tables, benches, desks, and other items.  He works six days a week, 11 hours a day, and earns about Le 1,500,000 every month from his business. Farrah has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and plans to use the proceeds of this loan to buy raw materials to make beds, tables, and chairs.  Farrah says a major business challege for him is that some customers will not pay in full for items they order, leaving unpaid balances that are difficult to collect.  He serves about 10 customers each day, and says his business is popular because of his quality production. He has two trainees in his workshop.

He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 230,000. In the future, Farrah plans to build his own house, to have a more business capital, and to see that his children are educated and have good standard of living.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make beds, tables, and chairs

loans.name: Ivannia

texts.es:
Ivannia
Puntarenas
500000
	Ivannia tiene un bazar Librería en la zona de Puntarenas, a pesar de lo cercano de la ciudad ella vive en un lugar de bastante pobreza y donde el comercio existente  es poco, le provee a los habitantes del lugar de servicios como fax, venta de cuadernos y accesorios para estudiantes así como regalos y juguetes para niños. El objetivo de este crédito es invertir en juguetes y productos para la época de navidad ya que las ventas se incrementan en esta época, al mismo tiempo se va a adquirir  ropa.
	Su día inicia a las 7 de la mañana ya que los niños que van para la escuela pasan a comprar varias cosas que van a necesitar  en su día o hacer fotocopias que es otro de los servicios que brinda. Al mismo tiempo en las tardes regresan  buscando materiales para realizar sus tareas por que el negocio pasa ocupado todo el día. Ella atiende también a su hija que estudia en la escuela de la localidad y a su compañero que se dedica a la  venta de mariscos.
	Entre sus metas destaca crecer con su tienda y ser una de de las mejores de la zona, por esto se empeña cada día en atender eficientemente a sus clientes, además su familia le brinda un gran apoyo  por esto desea superarse cada día más. 
	Su negocio ha caminado muy bien, ya tiene cerca de 3 años de trabajar en este, por lo que el principal problema  es la falta de dinero para trabajar, pero con la oportunidad brindada por Fundación Mujer con este préstamo se va a mejorar mucho la capacidad del negocio.
texts.en:
Ivannia has a general store in Puntarenas.  Despite its proximity to the city, she lives in an area of considerable poverty where there is little existing commerce.  Ivannia provides the local people with fax services and sells notebooks and supplies for students as well as gifts and toys for children.  The purpose of this loan is to purchase toys and items for the Christmas season since sales increase during this period.  She is also going to buy clothing.

She begins her day at seven in the morning as the children stop on their way to school to buy various things that they need for the day or to make photocopies, another service that she provides.  In the afternoon, the children return looking for materials to do their homework.  So, her business is busy all day.  She also takes care of her daughter, who attends the local school and her partner, who sells seafood.  Among her goals, she highlights growing her store and being one of the best in the area.  For this reason, she strives every day to serve her customers efficiently.  In addition, her family gives her a great deal of support and this motivates her to succeed more each day.  
She has been working on her business for nearly three years and it has been going very well. Her main problem is lack of working capital; however, with the support of this loan offered by Fundación Mujer, she will improve business capacity.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for the Christmas and New Year’s season with the goal of increasing sales and responding to customer requests.

loans.name: Maher

texts.en:
Maher is a 48-year-old man who is supporting a family of five members. A year ago, Maher opened a mini-market as a start for his own business, which he is depending on as a source for his family’s income.

Now, Maher has applied for a loan to bring in more food products and fill the mini-market with it so he can expand after making the required profit.

loans.use: to buy food products to fill his mini-market

loans.name: Melchora

texts.es:
Melchora tiene 21años, vive con sus padres en la ciudad de Carapeguá. Vive en pareja con Raúl, ambos se dedican a la venta ambulante de hamacas, sabanas, colchas y demás, haciendo sus recorridos en la zona metropolitana de la ciudad, específicamente en las ciudades aledañas a la capital.
Melchora, al terminar su ciclo básico de la escuela, ya se dedicó a la profesión ya que sus padres se dedican exclusivamente al campo, para que de esa forma pueda ayudar con los gastos de la casa.
Es una persona muy sacrificada ya que realiza las ventas casa por casa recorriendo varios kilómetros en su moto. Aprendió la profesión de su hermano ya que antes salía a hacer sus ventas con él y éste le inculco para que se dedique de lleno a las ventas para que así pueda crecer como persona y como profesional.
Ella solicita la ayuda de fundación paraguaya y de kiva para la compra de hamacas, sabanas, colchas y demás insumos para la venta posterior. Agradece a la fundación y de kiva por la oportunidad que estas le dan.
texts.en:
Melchora is 21 years old and lives with her parents in the city of Carapeguá.  She lives with her husband, Raúl and together they sell hammocks, sheets, bedspreads, and other things.  They are mobile sellers and make their runs in the metropolitan zone, specifically in the towns surrounding the capitol.

She is very dedicated and sells door to door, covering many kilometers on her motorcycle.  She learned this line of work from her brother and used to make her sales with him.  This motivated her to dedicate herself to this line of work so that she can grow as a person and professional.

Melchora started this line of work after having finished her first school cycle, in order to help out the family financially.  Her parents worked exclusively on the farm.

She is requesting assistance through Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva, in order to buy hammocks, sheets, bedspreads, and other items for resale.  She is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for the opportunity they provide.

loans.use: to buy sheets, bedspreads, and other items for resale.

loans.name: Sundos

texts.en:
Sundos is a 21-year-old lady, who has five sisters and one brother. Sundos is studying to get her bachelor degree in X-ray technology, and she is now in her third year.
After completing her bachelor degree, Sundos hopes to continue her studies to get a higher degree and work in the field. She wants to help her family's financial situation and help in teaching the rest of her sisters and brother. Sundos has applied for this loan to pay her semester tuition fees, so she can finish her studies.

loans.use: to pay her semester's tuition fees.

loans.name: Linketto Samba Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Linketto Samba est à  son cinquième cycle, il est composé 44 femmes qui s’activent dans le petit commerce : vente d’arachide, d’huile de palm et divers produits du terroir.

Madame Diadia  (debout à l’extrême droite)  est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 44 ans, mariée  et mère de six enfants, elle prend en charge six autres membres de sa famille.

Elle est  vendeuse de l’huile de palme et de savon traditionnel dans son village et aux villages environnants à l’occasion des marchés hebdomadaires. 

Son nouveau prêt lui permettra d’acheter de l’huile palme et du savon pour la revente.

Les bénéfices lui permettront d’apporter un soutien à son mari sur la prise en charge sanitaire des enfants et leur scolarisation.
texts.en:
The Linketto Samba group is in its fifth loan cycle and is made up of 44 women who occupy themselves with small businesses, selling groundnuts, palm oil and various local goods.

Mrs. Diadia (standing at the far right in the photo) is the group's leader. She is 44 years old, married and the mother of six children. She cares for six other members of her family.

Mrs. Diadia sells palm oil and traditional soap in her village and in nearby villages during their weekly markets. Her new loan will allow her to purchase palm oil and soap for resale. The profits will allow her to help support her husband in providing for the medical care of children and their education.

loans.use: To purchase palm oil and soap for resale.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Aminata is 31, and married to a man who is a maintenance officer.  Together they have three children aged two, four, and 13, two of whom go to school.  In 2006, Aminata started her business selling jeans, trousers, and shirts.  She is hardworking and honest.   Aminata began her business because her father didn't allow his daughters to attend school.  Aminata's elder sister was also deprived of an education.

After she reached maturity, her parents let her get married.  Her husband gave her money to start her own business.  Now Aminata works seven days a week for 11 hours a day, and earns about Le 1,100,000 a month.  Aminata has already received and successfully repaid two loans, and want to use the proceeds of this new loan to buy jean shorts and pants, and skirts. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits.  

Aminata says her main business challenge is the weather.  When it rains, she only has a tarp to cover her items.  Competition is stiff but she says she differentiates herself through quality and price difference.  She serves about 15 customers each day.  She employs a family member and her suppliers are located in Conakry, Guinea.  She transports her goods by public vehicle and she buys twice every month.

In the future, Aminata plans to rent a shop, build a house, and educate her children.  She feels good about taking this loan and hopes it will help her to generate more income.

loans.use: to buy denim shorts and pants, and skirts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy silver, gold, a digital scale and other things.

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en:
Sanaa is a 38-year-old single lady who lives by herself and has her own business. Her business is selling cosmetic products and materials at her house and at her sister’s beauty salon where she helps her sometimes. 

Now Sanaa wants to buy more products that were requested by some new customers. By satisfying the customers she will be able to expand and open her own cosmetics store.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics products for her business

loans.name: Nemataba / Labal Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de Némataba/Labal a en son actif plus de 17 cycles depuis l’inauguration à nos jours. Il compte 13 femmes qui habitent toutes le même village. Elles  font toutes le petit commerce.

Madame Aïssatou   (debout à l’extrême droite)  est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 44  ans, mariée  et mère de six enfants.

Elle est  vendeuse de l’arachide et de savon dans les marchés hebdomadaire aux environs de son village.

Son nouveau prêt lui permettra d’acheter de l’arachide et du savon pour la revente.

Les bénéfices lui permettront de soutenir son mari sur la prise en charge sanitaire des enfants.
texts.en:
The Naforé Group is in its 17th loan cycle. The group includes 22 women who all live in the same village. The all participate in small businesses.

Mrs. Aïssatou (standing at the far right in the photo) is the group's leader. She is 44 years old, married and the mother of six children.

Mrs. Aïssatou sells groundnuts and soap in the weekly markets near her village. Her new loan will allow her to purchase groundnuts and soap for resale. The profits will allow her to support her husband in providing for the medical care of children.

loans.use: To purchase groundnuts and soap for resale.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 30-year-old business man who lives in Juba. He is married and has three children between the ages of one and 10, two of whom go to school. 

Joseph sells food and household goods, and has had this business for a year and a half.  He heard about Kiva field partner Finance Sudan through a door-to-door promotion done by loan officers. He plans to use the proceeds of this loan to buy items such as tomato paste, powdered milk, salt, and detergent. This business is Joseph's only source of income, and in five years' time he hopes to be able to build his own shop.

loans.use: to buy items like tomato paste, powdered milk, salt, and detergent

loans.name: Manal

texts.en:
Manal is a 44-year-old married lady who established a small beauty salon at her house almost two years ago, so she can help her husband and her family financially.

Now Manal has applied for this loan to add another service which is selling cosmetics products so she can attract more customers and expand her business

loans.use: to add another service which is selling cosmetics products.

loans.name: Nemataba / Nafore Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Naforé a en son actif plus de 13 cycles depuis l’inauguration à nos jours. Il compte 13 femmes qui habitent toutes le même village. Elles  font toutes le petit commerce.

Madame Mariètou (debout à l’extrême droite)  est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 35 ans, mariée  et mère de six enfants.

Elle est  vendeuse de l’arachide, du riz en détail de plus elle fait de la restauration dans le village.

Son nouveau prêt lui permettra de renforcer son stock de riz.

Les bénéfices lui permettront d’apporter un soutien à son mari sur la prise en charge sanitaire des enfants et leur scolarisation.
texts.en:
The Naforé group has been active for more than 13 loan cycles since the beginning of this institution. It comprises 13 women who all live in the same town. They all run small retail businesses.

Ms. Mariètou (standing all the way on the right in the photo) is the group leader. She is 35 years old, married, and has six children.

She sells peanuts and rice at retail and also prepares and sells meals in her town.

Her new loan will allow her to increase her stocks of rice.

The profits will allow her to support her husband in providing for the children's health and education costs.

loans.use: To increase her stocks of rice.

loans.name: Olive

texts.en: Olive lives in Kongowea, Kenya. She is married and has three children all of whom are in school. Olive owns a shop where she sells foodstuffs like beans, maize, and oil.  She has had her business for four years and now employs two other people.  Olive also owns a mobile money transfer shop and rental houses.   Olive is applying for a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy beans, maize, oil, and other items.  She is looking forward to developing a parcel of land that she owns.

loans.use: to buy beans, maize, oil, and other items

loans.name: Dialicounda Kawral/ Tedungal Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Tedungal  est créé le 12 Octobre 2010 à l’inauguration du Banc Villageois qui l'abrite. Il est composé de 10 femmes qui ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Coumba  (en médaillon  à l’extrême droit) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 48 ans, est mariée et mère de huit enfants, elle prend à charge quatre aux membres de sa famille.

Elle vend du thé, du sucre et des condiments dans le marché de sa commune. Elle maîtrise bien cette activité pour l’avoir pratiqué pendant plus de cinq ans.

Avec son nouveau prêt elle compte s’approvisionner en sucre, et thé et autres produits divers.

Elle envisage de mieux soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge des dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
The Tedungal group was created on 12 October 2010 at the inauguration of the Local Village Fund under which it operates. It comprises ten women who primarily run small retail businesses.

Ms. Coumba (in the inset all the way on the right side of the photo) is the group leader. She is 48 years old, married, and has eight children. She also takes care of four other members of her family.

She sells tea, sugar, and condiments at the market in her town. She has mastered this business, having practiced it for more than five years.

With her new loan, she plans to supply herself with sugar, tea, and various other products. She intends to better support her husband in providing for the family.

loans.use: To supply herself with sugar, tea, and various other products.

loans.name: Edwin Rolando

texts.es:
Edwin vive y trabaja en Camaná, Perú, an oasis in the otherwise long, dry Sechura Desert that dominates the coastline in the Southwestern part of the country. Camaná was historically a major tourist destination in Perú, however, frequent and forceful earthquakes and tsunamis in the last decade (an 8.4 in 2001 and 8.0 in 2007) decimated the city, permanently destroyed Camaná’s tourism industry, and lost many their jobs, livelihoods, and homes. But the one upshot of unemployment is that it creates an environment primed for microfinance. Microfinance allows a jobless entrepreneur to realize their would-be microenterprises, like the one your client is pursuing today.
Edwin, es un hombre soltero de  28 años de edad,  el  se dedica al servicio de construcción como maestro de obras, eligio este oficio ya que su Padre se dedicaba a lo mismo.
Edwin es un hombre eficiente, responsable y muy trabajador con muchas ganas de salir adelante, Edwin empezó en el negocio desde el año 2005, gana semanalmente  un promedio de S/450 nuevos soles. Con el préstamo de S/. 2000 soles que recibirá gracias a KIVA, lo invertirá para el mejoramiento de la vivienda de sus padres ( construcción de cuartos). El desafió de el es en el mes de febrero y marzo por lo que no hay muchas obras. El  sueño de Edwin es seguir creciendo en su negocio y compararse un terreno para la construcción de su propia casa, ya que por el momento vive en la casa de sus padres, el señor Edwin esta muy agradecido por la oportunidad que se le esta brindando. su asesor cree que es un buen cliente y que si cumplirá en pagar puntualmente sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Edwin lives and works in Camaná, Peru, an oasis in the otherwise long, dry Sechura Desert that dominates the coastline in the Southwestern part of the country. Camaná was historically a major tourist destination in Perú.  However, frequent and forceful earthquakes and tsunamis in the last decade (an 8.4 in 2001 and 8.0 in 2007) decimated the city, permanently destroyed Camaná’s tourism industry, and lost many their jobs, livelihoods, and homes. The  upshot of unemployment is that it creates an environment primed for microfinance. Microfinance allows a jobless entrepreneur to set up their own micro-business, like the one this client is running today.

Edwin is a 28-year-old single man.  He works in the building trade as a master builder.  He chose this trade as his father used to do the same thing.

Edwin is an efficient, responsible and very hard-working man who has a great desire to get ahead in life.  He started out in his business in 2005.  He earns, on average, 450 soles a day.  With this loan for 2,000 soles, that he will receive thanks to Kiva, he will invest in improving his parents' home (building rooms).  The challenge Edwin faces is that in the months of February of March there are not many building projects to work on.  Edwin's dream is to continue growing in his business and to buy a plot of land on which he can build his own home as he currently lives in his parents' home.  Edwin is very grateful for the opportunity that he is being given.  His loan officer believes him to be a good client who will make his repayments on time.

loans.use: to improve his parents' home, building rooms

loans.name: Haytham

texts.en:
Haytham is a 47-year-old man who is supporting a family of seven members. He recently retired from a private company and started his own business. 

Haytham opened an electronics repair shop two years ago so as to have another monthly income beside his retirement. In his shop he repairs mostly TVs, stereos, etc.

Now he has applied for a loan to buy more tools that are required for improving his service, and he also wants to expand the shop space or area so it can fit more electronics and maybe hire someone to help him.

loans.use: To buy more tools for his electronics repair shop.

loans.name: Siham

texts.en:
Siham is a 54-year-old lady who loves children. She has always wanted to have her own business, so she combined between both and started a contract with one of schools in her area to take control of their cafeteria.

In the school’s cafeteria, Siham sells  sandwiches, snacks and drinks. It has been seven years now since she started working at the school and she is already known by the students.

Siham wants to add more and different food items to the cafeteria so the kids won't get bored with what she has, and that’s why she applied for a loan.

loans.use: To add more food types for the school cafeteria.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca nació en la  ciudad de Cusco y desde hace 33 años que radica en la ciudad del Ollantaytambo. Francisca tiene 53 años de edad y es casada y fruta de esta relación tiene cuatro hijos.

Francisca tienda de abarrotes en uno de los mercados populares de la ciudad de Ollantaytambo y también se dedica  a la venta de artesanía como por ejemplo tejidos,  bordados y platería. Ya son 15 a 20 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Francisca en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería para la tienda de abarrotes y para aumentar su artesanía. Sueño de Francisca es abrir un hotel en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo porque hay mucho movimiento de turistas. 

Francisca se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Francisca was born in the city of Cusco, and has lived in the city of Ollantaytambo for the past 33 years.  Francisca is 53 years old, married, and has four children from this union.

Francisca has a general store in one of the popular markets of the city of Ollantaytambo.  She also dedicates herself to selling handicrafts such as knitted goods, embroideries, and silver.  She has already dedicated herself to this business for 15 to 20 years, and things have gone well thanks to the effort she puts forth.  Francisca, at this time, requires a loan to buy merchandise for her general store and to increase her supply of handicrafts.  Her dream is to open a hotel in the city of Ollantaytambo because of the many tourists that move through the area.

Francisca finds herself grateful for the opportunity afforded her through this medium, and likewise commits to making her payments as scheduled.

loans.use: buy merchandise for her general store and increase her supply of handicrafts.

loans.name: Hermilia

texts.es: Hermilia, de 58 años es una mujer responsable. Vive en compañía de Alejandro, su esposo desde hace 29 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Edson y Emerson, a los que cuidan en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Ataura. Ella cuida a su papá que es anciano, juntos administran los terrenos que posee, ahí siembra maíz, papa y habas, en grandes cantidades. Con sus ganancias puede solventar los gastos que le genera cuidar a su papa, que tiene una salud delicada, pero no solo a ello se dedica, también cría animales como: 7 vacas, 8 ovejas, 4 cerdos y 40 cuyes, los cuales enseba para luego vender a un mayor precio a los carniceros que visitan la zona. También abrió una pequeña tienda de comestibles, donde vende productos de primera necesidad y bebidas de toda variedad. Mientras su esposo trabaja con un auto haciendo taxi y administra los otros 2, que adquirieron con mucho esfuerzo. Ahora tiene que trabajar con más esfuerzo, pues sus hijos estudian en una universidad reconocida y tiene que solventar sus gastos. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario, “palomitas”, y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde agradece al apoyo de todos ustedes, pues hace posible que continúe con su trabajo. Además promete ser puntual en sus cuotas, ya que le agrada trabajar con personas responsables y solidarias. Hermilia de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado, en convertir a gas el funcionamiento de su auto; que es a petróleo. Con ello podrá minimizar los costos.
texts.en:
Hermilia is 58 years old and a very responsible woman.  She lives with Alejandro, her husband of 29 years.  They have 2 children together, Edson and Emerson, who they care for in their own home in the Ataura locality.

She tends to her father, who is elderly, and they both manage the lands that he owns.  There, they plant corn, potatoes and beans in large quantities.  With the earnings, she can meet the expenses of caring for her father, whose health is delicate.  She doesn’t dedicate herself only to farming, but also raises animals such as:  7 cows, 8 sheep, 4 pigs and 40 guinea pigs, which she then sells at a higher price to the butchers who visit the zone.

She also opened a small food store where she sells basic needs items and beverages of all types.  While her husband works as a taxi driver, she manages the other 2, which require a great deal of effort.  She now has to work harder, since her two children are studying at a well-known university and she has to meet those expenses.

She belongs to the “Palomitas” cooperative bank, and this is her second loan with MFP.  She is thankful for all of your help, as it has made it possible for her to continue with her work.  In addition, she commits to being punctual with her payments, as she enjoys working with people who are responsible and supportive.  Hermilia, at receiving your funds, will invest in converting her car to gas, as it is currently petroleum.  With this change, she will be able to minimize costs.

loans.use: convert her vehicle from petroleum to gas.

loans.name: Nelido

texts.es:
El Sr. Nelido tiene 42 años de edad, vive en pareja con la Sra. Teresa hace más de 10 años, tienen 3 hijos juntos, todos en edad escolar quienes viven en la cuidad de Carapeguá.
Como proviene de una familia humilde y con ganas de salir adelante decidió trabajar como ayudante de albañil, en poco tiempo logró juntar un poco de capital para empezar a comprar hamacas, frazadas, fajas y sábanas que trae a vender por la capital del país, donde ya tiene una buena clientela formada. Gracias a su trabajo y esfuerzo pudo comprarse una motocicleta, la cual utiliza para realizar sus ventas y mantener la buena clientela.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de hamacas, frazadas, fajas y sábanas, puesto que tiene muchos pedidos de estos productos
texts.en:
Nelido, age 42, has lived with his life partner, Teresa, for over ten years.  They have three children, and all of them are school age.  They live in the city of Carapegué.

As he comes from a humble family, and has the desire to get ahead, he decided to work as a bricklayer.  In a small amount of time he managed to get a little capital together to start buying hammocks, blankets, belts, and sheets that he takes to sell at the country’s capital.  He already has a good client base there.

Thanks to his work and effort he was able to buy a motorcycle.  He uses it to make his sales and to retain his good clientele.

He is requesting the loan to buy hammocks, blankets, belts, and sheets given that he has a lot of orders for those products.

loans.use: to buy hammocks, blankets, belts, and sheets to later sell.

loans.name: Gloria Estela

texts.es:
La señora Gloria tiene 28 años de edad y viven en una aldea del municipio de La Lima, Cortes. Ella es madre soltera y tiene 1 hijo de 1 año de edad.

A Gloria le gusta mucho la decoración y las manualidades. Ella dedica a la elaboración de bisutería como pulseras, aritos, collares y anillos. Tiene aproximadamente 4 años de hacer esta actividad y le dedica medio tiempo todos los días. Puso el negocio por necesidad de generar un fuente de ingreso para su familia y superar económicamente. 

Solicitó este crédito de L6,000 para invertir en la compra de materiales para elaborar aritos, pulseras, anillos y collares.  Su sueño es hacer que su negocio crezca en clientes y lograr mayores ventas de su producto. En el futuro, le gustaría impulsar otro negocio como la venta de frutas y verduras para diversificar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Gloria, 28, lives in a village in the municipality of La Lima, Cortes.  She’s a single mother of a one-year-old son.

Gloria enjoys decorating and manual arts.  She makes costume jewelry like bracelets, hoops, necklaces and rings.  She’s been in this line of work for approximately four years and she spends half a day, every day doing it.  She opened the business because she needed a source of income for her family and to get ahead economically.

She requested this L6,000 loan to buy supplies to make hoops, necklaces, rings and bracelets.  Her dream is to make her business grow in number of customers and to increase sales of her product.  In the future, she’d like to go into another type of business like fruit and vegetables sales to diversify her sources of income.

loans.use: to buy suppies to make hoops, bracelets, rings and necklaces.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Mujeres En Acción Group

texts.es:
Perfil Banco Mujer Mujeres en Acción 
Fray Casiano Puntarenas
Noviembre 2011

		De las solicitantes del préstamo grupal la presidenta Xinia se dedica al negocio de pulpería, el interés con este préstamo es el de aumentar sus ventas por la temporada de fin de año. Tiene 40 años de edad y dos hijos que viven actualmente con ella, uno es menor de edad y el otro le ayuda en el negocio.
Se levanta a las 6 de la mañana para la venta del pan y enviar a su hijo a la escuela, luego se dedica a atender a los agentes y acomodar la mercadería. Luego prepara el almuerzo y cierra a las 11 de la noche.

Su objetivo principal es sentirse una mujer de éxito empresarial y ayudar en la educación y futuro de sus hijos. Una limitante es el equipo ya que se requiere dinero para comprar un congelador para poder vender mas refrescos y helados, pero con sus recursos a logrado mantenerse durante ya 5 años.

Las señoras del grupo se conocieron ya que son vecinas y han trabajado juntas en rifas y ventas en su comunidad. Deciden trabajar en la metodología de Banco Mujer de Fundación Mujer para lograr sus metas y poder apoyar económicamente a sus familias. El nombre refleja su actitud, mantenerse en acción para lograr sus objetivos.
texts.en:
Banco Mujer Profile: “Mujeres en Acción” [Women in Action]
Fray Casiano Puntarenas
November 2011

Xinia is the president of this group and runs a small general store. Her interest in this loan is to increase her sales due to the high season that takes place at the end of the year. She is 40 years old and has two children who live with her. One is a minor and the other helps her with the business. She gets up at 6am to sell break and send her son to school. Then she works attending to clients and managing her merchandise. She later makes lunch and closes at 11 at night.

Her main goal is to feel like a successful businesswoman, and help her children with their education and future. One of her limitations is equipment; she needs money to purchase a freezer in order to sell more juices and ice cream. But she has managed to get along with her current resources for the last 5 years.

The women in the group have known each other for a while since they are all neighbors and have worked together on raffles and various sales in their communities. They decided to work as a communal bank with Fundacion Mujer to achieve their goals and help their families economically. The name reflects their attitudes, staying active to achieve their goals.

loans.use: to buy seasonal merchandise for a stationary store, an internet café, and catalog sales

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy body cream, perfume, and soap for washing and bathing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy jeans, women's clothing, and shoes.

loans.name: Khary

texts.fr: Mademoiselle Khary est âgée  de 29 ans . Elle vit au Sénégal. Elle évolue depuis un an dans le secteur du commerce et pratique la vente de tissus.  Elle a travaillé pendant des  années pour le compte de sa tante. Actuellement son vœu est de faire ses propres affaires pour pouvoir mieux bénéficier des fruits de son travail. Elle est sociétaire d’un guichet  de l’U-IMCEC de la localité ou elle habite. Elle sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs prévu pour honorer une commande que ses fournisseurs  lui avaient livré et qui sont destinés a la vente. Son objectif est d’accroitre ses gains financiers.
texts.en: Khary is 29 years old. She lives in Senegal. She has been involved in business the for the past year selling fabric. She has worked for many years for her aunt.  Now she is hoping to have her own business to better benefit from the fruits of her labor.   She is a member of her local UIMCEC branch.  She is requesting a loan of  200,000 XOF to pay for an order made with her suppliers.  The order has been delivered and is ready to be sold.  Her goal is to increase her profits.

loans.use: to pay for an order of fabric for resale

loans.name: Khadidiatou

texts.fr: Madame Khadidiatou  vit au Sénégal. C’est une femme marié de 34 ans qui  exerce l’activité de femme de ménage. Parallèlement  elle pratique le commerce et la vente de tissus teintés, parfums, lait  de corps, etc. Elle capitalise une expérience de   plus de 10 ans dans son activité qu’elle a choisi sous l’influence de sa maman. Elle est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis juillet 2011. Elle sollicite un crédit de 150 000frs prévu pour  l’achat de tissus teintés qu’elle avait commandé et qui sont destinés a la vente. Son objectif est de développer son activité et accroitre ses bénéfices.
texts.en: Mrs. Khadidiatou lives in Sénégal. She is married, 34 years old and works as a housekeeper. At the same time, she manages a busines of selling dyed fabrics, perfumes and lotions. Following in her mother's footsteps, she has over 10 years of experience in the business. She has been a member of U-IMCEC since July 2011. She is requesting a loan of 150,000 cfa francs to pay for an order of dyed fabric which she intends to resell. Her goal is to grow her business and increase profits.

loans.use: to purchase one order of fabric for resale

loans.name: Romania

texts.es:
Romania nació en la ciudad del Ollantaytambo y tiene 49 años de edad y es casada y fruta de esta relación tiene tres hijos.

Romania tiene un restaurante en su propio domicilio. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Romania en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar gaseosas, cervezas e insumos. 

Romania se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Romania was born in the city of Ollantaytambo.  She is 49 years old and married, and has three children from this relationship.

Romania has a restaurant in her own home.  She has been working in this business for several years now, and it is going very well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her work.

Right now Romania needs a loan to buy soda, beer, and consumables.

Romania is grateful for the opportunity offered by this loan and so is committed to making her payments in accordance with the schedule.

loans.use: to buy soda, beer, and consumables.

loans.name: Maria Esperanza

texts.es:
María es una persona muy responsable con su trabajo y carismática con las personas. María es soltera, tiene 50 años y vive con su hijo en San Gabriel que se encuentra en la Provincia de el Carchi al Norte de Ecuador.

María se dedica a la compra venta de cerdos por un tiempo de 15 años, ella empezó su negocio con una cantidad mínima de cerdos y con un socio lo que las utilidades tenían que repartirse, ahora tiene sus propios cerditos. Es el primer crédito que solicita a Fodemi el mismo que va a ser invertido en la compra de cerdos y para la reparación del corral, esta inversión le ayudará a que su negocio se incremente y que sus ventas crezcan y así poder obtener muy buenos ingresos.

Su sueño es poder contruir un corral mejor donde puedan vivir bien sus cerdos y en lo familiar desea tener una vida digna y llevadera.
texts.en:
María is a person who is very responsible in her work and displays her charisma with other people. She is 50 years old, single, and lives with her son in San Gabriel, which is located in the province of El Carchi in northern Ecuador.

María has been buying and selling pigs for 15 years. She started this business with a minimal number of pigs and split the profits with a partner. Now she has her own piglets. This is the first loan she is requesting from FODEMI. María will invest in the purchase of pigs and repairs to her animal pen. This investment will help grow her business and increase her sales so that she can generate a better income.

Her dream is to build a better pen where her pigs can live well. She also hopes that her family will have a decent and bearable life.

loans.use: to buy pigs and to make repairs to her animal pen.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
El señor Miguel tiene 28 años de edad y vive en una aldea de Tela, Atlántida. Lleva 4 años de casado con su esposa Keyla, la cual es ama de casa y colabora en el negocio junto con él. La pareja tiene una niño de 1 año de edad. 

El negocio de don Miguel consiste en la venta de hotdogs, frutas, jugos naturales y mercadería. Empezó el negocio hace 2 años y le dedica 10 horas diarias. Antes, trabajaba en una ferretería en San Pedro Sula, pero quiso poner su propio negocio para poder atender mejor a su familia y tener tiempo de asistir a la iglesia. Sacó un crédito para empezar el negocio y a pesar de la delincuencia y la competencia, ha podido salir adelante y surtir el negocio. 

Solicitó este crédito de L18,000 para surtir su inventario. Va invertir en la compra de uvas, manzanas y ropa para la temporada navideña. Miguel espera poder brindarle a su hijo una buena educación y lograr fortalecer su negocio para poder brindar a sus clientes lo que ellos pidan y así mantener la clientela contenta.
texts.en:
Miguel, 28, lives in a village in Tela, Atlántida.  He has been married to Kayla for four years.  She’s a housewife and helps him out with the business.  The couple has a one-year old son.

Miguel’s business consists in selling hot-dogs, fruit, fruit juice and merchandise.  He started the business two years ago and he puts in 10-hour work days.  He used to work in a hardware store in San Pedro Sula but he wanted to open his own business to better take care of his family and have time to attend church.  He took out a loan to start the business and despite delinquency and competition has been able to get ahead and stock the business.

He requested this L18,000 loan to stock inventory.  He will buy grapes, apples and clothes for the Christmas season.  Miguel hopes to be able to provide his son with a good education and manage to strengthen the business to provide his customers with what they request so that he can keep the clientele happy.

loans.use: to buy grapes, apples and winter clothes.

loans.name: Lazaro Alejandro

texts.es:
El señor Lazaro Alejandro es casado, tiene 38 años de edad, estudio solo en primaria, tiene 2 hijos los cuales estudian, se dedica a la tejeduría de cortes típicos, inició este trabajo como operario y hasta el momento lleva 15 años de experiencia.

Solicita un préstamo para ampliar su capital de trabajo, en la compra de hilos de diferentes colores, y tener mas producción, espera en el futuro ver su negocio, con mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Lazaro Alejandro is 38 years old, married, and has only an elementary school education.  He has 2 children who are in school, and he has a business weaving traditional Guatemalan fabrics.  He started doing this type of work as an employee, and he now has 15 years of experience.

He requests a loan to expand his working capital, by purchasing thread in different colors so he can increase his production.  In the future he hopes to see his business have better earnings.

loans.use: to buy thread for his weaving business

loans.name: Higinio

texts.es:
El señor Higinio esta solicita el préstamo para la colocación del vitropiso de un cuarto y así su familia podrá tener mayor comodidad, ya que en la comunidad donde vive las calles se encuentran en malas condiciones, y cuando llueve entra humedad a su casa y quiere evitar enfermedades. 
Don Higinio sea dedicado a la construcción desde hace mas de 30 años y cuenta con mucha gente solicita su servicios de albañilea, es una persona trabajadora y responsable. La esposa del señor Higinio lo ayudara en la economía familiar con las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio de venta de ropa usada a fuera de su vivienda.
texts.en: Higinio is requesting a loan to put tile in a room so that his family could live in greater comfort.  In the community where he lives the streets are in bad condition and when it rains the moisture comes into the home, and he wants to avoid the illness this can cause.  Higinio has worked in construction for more than 30 years, and many people seek out his construction services.  He is a hardworking and responsible person.  Higinio's wife helps him with the family's finances with earnings she obtains from a business she has selling used clothing outside the home.

loans.use: to put a tile floor in a room

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es:
Aurelia vive en la ciudad del Ollantaytambo y tiene 57 años D. edad y es casada y fruta D. esta relación tiene cinco hijos.

Aurelia se dedica a la venta D. frutas en uno D. los mercados D. la ciudad D. Ollantaytambo, ella tiene un puesto D. venta  pero que es alquilado. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Aurelia en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar frutas. Su sueño D. Aurelia es comprar un carro. 

Aurelia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Aurelia lives in the city of Ollantaytambo.  She is 57 years old, married, and she and her husband have 5 children.

Aurelia has a business selling fruit in one of the markets in the city of Ollantaytambo.  She has a sales post, but it is rented.  She has had this business for a number of years, and it is going very well thanks to the effort that she puts into her work.  At this time, Aurelia needs a loan to buy fruit.  Aurelia's dream is to buy a car.

Aurelia is grateful for the opportunity being provided through these means, and she pledges to make her payments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy fruit

loans.name: Sonia Marisol

texts.es:
Sonia es una persona luchadora y emprendedora, le gusta salir adelante en las cosas que hace. Es una mujer soltera de 32 años, tiene 3 hijos de 6, 5 y 2 años de edad, vive con ellos en San Gabriel en el Norte de Ecuador.

Sonia trabaja sola en la crianza y venta de cerdos, empezó a trabajar con su mamá con una cerdita y las ganancias eran a medias con su mamá, pero ahora por sus hijos tiene la necesida de incrementar sus ingresos para poderles mantener y darles el estudi, es por eso que realiza su primer crédito a Fodemi el mismo que va a ser invertido en la compra de cerdos para hacerlos reproducir y de esta manera que su negocio pueda crecer en cuanto a cantidady unos buenos ingresos.

Su sueño es mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y desea convertirse en una gran microempresaria.
texts.en:
Sonia is a hardworking and enterprising person who likes to succeed in the things that she does.  She is a 32 year-old single mother of 3 children, aged 6, 5 and 2.  She lives with them in San Gabriel in northern Ecuador.

Sonia works alone raising and selling pigs.  She started doing this type of work with her mother and a baby pig, and she shared the earnings with her mother.  But now, because of her children, she needs to increase her income so that she can support them and provide them with an education.  For this reason she is taking her first loan with FODEMI, which she will invest in the purchase of pigs to breed.  In this way her business can grow and generate a good income.

Her dream is to improve her family's quality of life, and she wants to become a great small businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy pigs to breed

loans.name: Jamesetta

texts.en:
Jamesetta is 38 years old and lives in Paynesville,   She is a high school graduate and is married to an engineer with whom she has five children aged  two to 19 years old.  All of her children attend school, except for the youngest one.

For the past two years Jamesetta has been selling sugar, onions, and flour at the market.  She started her business with loan that she received from Kiva field partner BRAC.  Jamesetta plans to use the proceeds of this loan to buy sugar, onions, and flour in bulk.  She hopes to become as international businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy sugar, onions, and flour in bulk

loans.name: Juana  Aracelly

texts.es: Doña Juana , habitante de la ciudad de León, casada, madre de tres hijos, de oficio comerciante se dedica a la venta de ropa usada y comida. Esta muy feliz y agradecida por la oportunidad que le brindo el crédito Kiva ya que lo utilizo para comprar ropa usada e invertir en su negocio de comida, logro vender toda la paca de ropa de usada, sus ganancias fueron muy buenas, le permitió comenzar hacer mejores a su tramo y su hogar. Ella solicita un nuevo crédito para invertirlo en comprar una paca de ropa usada mixta. Ya que se acerca la temporada  navideña donde las ventas son muy buenas y desea tener productos para ofrecer. Su próximos planes acondicionar el tramo para poner comideria al mismo tiempo vender ropa usaday seguir haciendo reparaciones a su casa.
texts.en:
Juana lives in the city of León.  She is married and has three children.  Juana is a saleswoman by trade.  She sells used-clothing, and food.  She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity she was given with her previous Kiva loan as she used it to buy used clothing and invest in her food business.  She managed to sell the whole bundle of used clothing, her profits were very good and they allowed her to start making improvements to her sales location and her home.

Juana is requesting a new loan to invest in buying a bundle of mixed, used clothing.  The Christmas season is approaching and this is when sales are very good.  She would therefore like to have products to offer.  Juana's plans for the near future are to work on her sales location so that she can set up an eatery which she can run at the same time as she sells her used clothing.  She would also like to continue making repairs to her home.

loans.use: to buy more used clothing

loans.name: Karina

texts.es: La socia Karina sigue estudiando en la universidad la carrera profesional de Biología, ella en esta ocasion desea hacer un negocio con su mamá y su hermana, la socia desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de adornos para poder venderlos en esta epoca de navidad, en la feria de San Pedro; la socia desea poder invertir el prestamo en la campaña navideña para ganar un dinero extra y terminar sus estudios.
texts.en: Karina continues to study biology at the university. Currently she wants to start a business with her mother and sister. She will invest the loan in Christmas decorations to sell during the Christmas season, particularly in the San Pedro market. Karina wants to be able to invest in the Christmas season to gain extra money and finish her studies.

loans.use: to buy christmas decorations for sale.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa is 39 years old and lives in Paynesville.  She’s married and her husband is a businessman.  Together they have two children, one of whom lives at home and attends school.

Hawa sells oil and pepper and has had her business for ten years.  She was taught how to run a business by her mother.  Her main challenge in business is how to cope with increases in wholesale prices of the things she sells.  She plans to use the proceeds of this loan to buy more oil and pepper. In future, she hops to build her own house and to become an international businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase more oil and pepper

loans.name: Momar

texts.fr: Monsieur Momar est âgé de 35 ans. Il vit dans une des localités du Sénégal. Il est célibataire et s’adonne au maraichage et  au commerce de légumes et  de poulets de chair. Il a une expérience de 10 ans dans son activité de commerce qu’il  a choisi par opportunité.  Ce qui l’intéresse  surtout ce sont la rentabilité et les  flux financiers générés par son activité.Il est sociétaire de l'un des guichets de l'U-IMCEC depuis mai 2007. Il a déjà remboursé 4 crédits antérieurs.Il sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs prévu pour l'achat de moutons qu'il compte revendre afin de diversifier d'avantage son acticité de commerce. Son objectif est d’augmenter  ses bénéfices ce qui lui permet de régler ses problèmes sociaux sans demander le soutien de personne.
texts.en: Mr. Momar is 35 years old. He lives in a city of Sénégal. He is single, devotes himself to small-scale farming and a business of selling vegetables and chickens. He has 10 years experience in this business after realizing it was a good opportunity. He is most concerned with profitability and cash flows generated by the business. He has been a member of U-IMCEC since May 2007. He has properly reimbursed four previous loans. He is requesting a loan of 300,000 cfa francs to purchase sheep for resale in order to diversify his business. His goal is to increase his profits so that he can take care of his responsibilities without asking others for help.

loans.use: to purchase sheep for resale.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr:
Fatou est une femme mariée âgée de 40 ans et elle mère de 6 enfants et  2 autres enfants sont à sa charge.
Elle est membre du banc villageois depuis le 06/03/2009.
Fatou fait parti du groupe de solidarité Takku liguey .
Elle vient de bénéficier  d'un prêt de 200000 francs cfa et avec ce prêt elle va acheter de la marchandise tels que le mil le maïs des chaussures prêt fabriqués et parfums destinés à la revente.
Avec les bénéfices qu'elle va réaliser elle compte aider son mari dans la prise en charge scolaire et sanitaire de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Fatou is married, 40 years old, a mother to six children and takes care of two other children.
She has been a member of Banc Villageois since March 6, 2009.
Fatou is a member of the solidarity group, Takku liguey.
She has just received a loan of 200,000 cfa francs. She is going to purchase merchandise for resale such as, millet, corn, ready-made shoes and perfumes.
With her profits, she intends to help her husband with the household expenses such as their children's schooling and health needs.

loans.use: to purchase millet, shoes, and chickens for resale.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: La socia desea el prestamo para invertir en la compra de un artefacto para su hogar; la socia compra diversos electrodomesticos y otros para implementar su hogar y paga poco a poco las cuotas en el banco con lo que le remuneran en su trabajo, la socia en esta ocasion desea comprar una computadora para uso personal. la socia tambien da clases de reforzamiento de forma particular; la socia desea seguir prosperando para dar mejor calidad de vida. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de una computadora para uso personal.
texts.en: This client wants to invest the loan to buy an artifact for her home. She will buy various appliances and other things to improve her home and will make payments little by little to the bank with income from her job. In particular, this client wants to buy a computer for personal use. She also gives personal development classes. She hopes to continue prospering in order to improve her quality of life. She is asking for the loan to buy a computer for personal use.

loans.use: to buy a computer for personal use.

loans.name: Oscar Danilo

texts.es:
Oscar ha presentado una capacidad grande en relación de cumplir su proyecto de mejorar y construir por completo su vivienda, actualmente trabaja en el campó de construcción como albañil siendo de gran ventaja por su conocimiento y agilidad para construir. Presento algunas dificultades por el cambio de trabajo ocasionando descontrol en el lado financiero del hogar. Su mayor plan es comprar el terreno en donde vive actualmente ya que pertenece a su suegra. No es ningún riesgo de pérdida ya que es de confiar.
Con este nuevo préstamo comprara cerámica, plycem, cemento entre otros para colocar en su cuarto anteriormente construido y también para división en partes con el plycem. Agradece por el apoyo constante al mejoramiento de su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Oscar has demonstrated a great capacity to complete a project like building and improving his home.  He works in the construction field as a mason, which is advantageous given his sense and knowledge of construction.  Changing jobs presented some difficulties because of the financial situation in the home.  His main plan is to buy some land from his mother in law, located where he currently lives.  There is no risk of loss because he trusts her.

He will use the money from this loan to buy ceramic, plycem, cement, and other things he needs to finish a previously constructed room.  He appreciates the constant support for improving his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Giovanna Jazelli

texts.es: Nuevamente Giovanna está aplicando a su  credikiva en el último trimestre del año y esto es justamente para invertirlo en accesorios femeninos papelería y adornos navideños . Ella se siente muy agradecida con sus inversiones y una vez mas agradece la confianza que los financiadores han depositado en ella.
texts.en:
Giovanna is again applying for a Kiva loan in the last trimester of the year, precisely to invest it in women's accessories, stationery items, and Christmas decorations.

She is grateful for her investments and once again she appreciates the trust that the financial backers have placed in her.

loans.use: to buy women's accessories, stationery items, and holiday decorations.

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es:
El  Sr. Enrique es de Ciudad del Este, tiene 4 hijos que aun van a la escuela. Él tiene una pequeña despensa, cuya venta cada vez más está en ascenso, generándole un buen ingreso.
Con la ayuda de su esposa  y toda la familia están saliendo adelante con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo. El junto a su esposa trabajan con mucho sacrificio para ofrecerle a sus hijos un mejor futuro del que ellos tuvieron, ya que no quieren que los mismos pasen por privaciones.
Hoy día él es un microempresario exitoso con una clientela fiel y numerosa, debido a su amabilidad. Se caracteriza por ser una persona responsable y honesta con sus compromisos. El tiene muchas ganas de crecimiento y por ello solicita el crédito, para la compra de bebidas, comestibles, panificados y demás, con lo cual podrá abastecer su local.
texts.en:
Enrique is from Ciudad de Este.  He has four school-age children.  He has a small store where sales are increasingly on the rise, generating a good income. With the help of his wife and his entire family and with much sacrifice and hard work, they are getting ahead in life.  He and his wife sacrifice a great deal in order to provide their children with better opportunities for the future than they had as they don’t want them to go through the same hardships.  
Today, Enrique is a successful small businessman and because of his kindheartedness, his customers are numerous and loyal. He is a responsible person who honors his commitments.  He wants to grow his business.  So, he is requesting this loan to buy beverages, groceries, baked goods, and other products to supply his store.

loans.use: to purchase beverages, groceries, baked goods, and other supplies.

loans.name: Nelson Vladimir

texts.es:
Nelson es una persona muy trabajadora, responsable con sus actividades y su familia. Nelson tiene 34 años vive con sus 4 hijos en  San Gabriel. Nelson trabaja en la compra venta de ganado para carnicos.

Empezó su trabajo desd muy jóven, sus padres le regalaron unos terneros y le gustó es por eso que sigue con el negocio. Es el primer crédito que solicita a Fodemi el mismo que va a ser utilizado en la compra de ganado ya que actualmente la demanda sube por la temporada de fin de año y quiere aprovechar esa oportunidad ya que le generaría muy buenos ingresos que le ayudan a mantener a su familia y poder dar el estudio a sus hijos.

Su sueño es poder entrar en el negocio de vacas lecheras, y seguir creciendo laboralmente.
texts.en:
Nelson is a very hardworking person.  He is responsible with his family and his activities. Nelson is 34 years old and lives with his 4 children in San Gabriel. Nelson works selling livestock for meat. 

He started doing this work when he was very young. His parents bought him calves and liked doing this so he stayed in the business. This is his first loan from Fodemi, which he will use to buy livestock since there is an increasing demand at the end of this season. He wants to take advantage of this opportunity since he would generate a very good income that will help him take care of his family and be able to provide an education for his children.   

His dream is to be able to include dairy cows in his business and continue growing and developing.

loans.use: to buy livestock since there is an increasing demand.

loans.name: Sergio Geronimo

texts.es:
Sergio vive en la ciudad del Ollantaytambo y tiene 26 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre. 

Sergio trabaja en un hospedaje como recepcionista y también tiene un negocio familiar que consiste en la venta de ropa. Ya son siete meses que él y su pareja se dedican a este negocio y les va muy bien gracias al empeño que ponen en su trabajo. Sergio en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercadería como por ejemplo pantalones y otras cosas más. Su sueño de Sergio es comprar una casa. 

Sergio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Sergio lives in the city of Ollantaytambo, he is 26 years old and he has a partner.

Sergio works as a receptionist in a boarding house and he also has a family business which involves selling clothes. He and his wife have been working in this business for seven months and it is going very well for them thanks to the effort they put into their work. On this occasion, Sergio needs the loan to buy more merchandise such as pants, among other items. Sergio's dream is to buy a house.

Sergio is grateful for the opportunity that has been given to him and he therefore promises to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise such as pants, among other items.

loans.name: Dialicounda Kawral/ Sabougnima 01 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Sabougnima 01 est créé le 12 Octobre 2010 à l’inauguration du Banc Villageois Dialicounda Kawral. Il est composé de six femmes qui habitent le même village.

Madame Mariama  (en médaillon en bas à l’extrême droit) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 45 ans, mariée et mère de quatre enfants. 

Elle vend du poisson fumé, elle importe des pays frontaliers  vers les marchés hebdomadaires de sa localité. Elle a une bonne maîtrise de son activité pour l’avoir  pratiquée pendant plusieurs années.

Son nouveau prêt lui permettra de s’approvisionner en poisson fumé pour la revente.

Les bénéfices lui permettront d’aider son marie dans la prise en charge scolaire et alimentaire de la famille.
texts.en:
The group Sabougnima 01 was founded on October 12, 2010 with the inauguration of the Banc Villageois Dialicounda Kawral. The group consists of 6 women who live in the same village. 

Mariama (inset at the bottom right corner) is in charge the group. She is 45 years old, married, and has 4 children. She sells smoked fish, which she imports from neighboring countries and brings to the weekly markets in her village. She has a good command of her work as she has been doing it for many years. 

This new loan will allow her to buy and resell smoked fish. The profits will allow her to help her husband with their family's school and food expenses.

loans.use: to buy smoked fish for resale.

loans.name: Ngoné

texts.fr: Madame Ngoné est une femme de 57 ans qui vit dans une des communautés sénégalaises. Elle est veuve et  dispose de chambres qui lui appartiennent et qu’elle a mises en location. Elle est sociétaire du guichet de l’U-IMCEC de cette localité depuis décembre 2005 et a déjà remboursé 3 prêts antérieurs. Elle sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs prévu pour le dallage de deux chambres à usage de location. Ses revenus de location lui permettent de prendre en charge tous  ses besoins personnels.
texts.en: Mrs. Ngoné is 57 years old and lives in a city of Senegal. She is a widow and owns rooms which she rents out. She has been a member of U-IMCEC at this location since December 2005. She has properly reimbursed three previous loans. She is requesting a loan of 300,000 cfa francs in order to renovate two rooms for rental. The rental profits help her to take care of all her personal needs.

loans.use: to finance the renovation of two rooms.

loans.name: Jade

texts.es:
Jade, de 29 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, con muchas ganas de progresar y salir adelante, es conviviente con Edgar, fruto de esa unión tiene tres hermosos hijos de 13, 8 y 2 años, que cómodamente están instalados en su propia casa. 

La actividad que realiza Jade es la venta de golosinas y bebidas gaseosas, para eso acondicionó un pequeño espacio en su casa donde acomodó toda su mercadería de golosinas e instaló su refrigerador donde guarda sus bebidas gaseosas a temperaturas que les agrada a sus clientes siendo de su preferencias por las temperaturas de éste clima tropical. 

Viendo la acogida que tuvo su negocio decidió seguir,  teniendo ya 7 años de funcionamiento contando con la ayuda de  su hija para atender a sus clientes que en su mayoría son sus vecinos. 

Lo que le gusta de su activad es el poder estar en actividad, sentirse ocupada y una mujer productiva, ya que le distrae y le permite socializar con los vecinos e intercambiar ideas, logrando así ganarse sus amistad, con éste trato social es que ha sabido ganarse la preferencia de sus clientes, y ahora tiene planes de ampliar su negocio y variar con abarrotes  y abrir una bodega. 

Este será el préstamo número 3 con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se siente cómoda con su grupo, ya que los considera personas responsables y solidarias. Con el monto solicitado de 2000 nuevos soles, los invertirá en la compra de golosinas y gaseosas en mayor volumen y a menos precios, para así obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Jade, 29, is a hard-working woman who very much wants to make progress and get ahead.  She lives with Edgar and from this union has three beautiful children, ages 13, 8, and 2, and they live comfortably in their own home.

Jade works selling candy and soda, for which she equipped a small space in her house where she arranged all her candy merchandise and put in a refrigerator, where she keeps her sodas at a temperature that her customers like, their preference being for the temperatures of this tropical climate.

Seeing the welcome her business had, she decided to continue.  Now she has seven years in the business, and has the help of her daughter to take care of the customers, who are mainly her neighbors.

What she likes about her job is being active, feeling herself a busy and productive woman, because it distracts her and allows her to socialize with the neighbors and exchange ideas, managing in this way to gain their friendship.  With this socializing she has been able to gain the preference of her customers, and now she has plans to expand her business and diversify it with groceries and open a store.

This will be her third loan with the MFP institution, for which she hopes for your collaboration to continue with her goals.  On the other hand, she feels comfortable with her group, since she considers them responsible and supportive people.

With the requested amount of 2000 PEN, she will buy larger quantities of candy and soda at lower prices to get better profits.

loans.use: to buy candy and soda.

loans.name: Maira Yecenia

texts.es:
La señora Maira tiene 35 años de edad y vive en la aldea de San Antonio en el municipio de La Lopez. Ella es casada y su esposo Rafael es comerciante. La pareja tiene dos hijos de 6 y 11/2 años de edad. Los dos adultos aportan económicamente a los gastos familiares. 

Doña Maira especializa en la venta de cosméticos. Ella toma pedidos de catalogo y proporciona los productos a su clientela. Vende desde su casa y de forma ambulante. Empezó este negocio hace 7 años. En aquellos tiempos ella experimentó con varios negocios buscando uno que era rentable. Realizó que vender cosméticos era muy rentable y decidió poner el negocio. 

Solicitó este crédito de L10,000 para la compra de lociones y cremas. Ella espera que el crédito le ayuda hacer más grande su negocio. En un futuro, desea tener su propio local comercial para no seguir con la venta ambulante.
texts.en:
Maira, 35, lives in the village of San Antonio in La Lopez Municipality.  She’s married to her husband, Rafael, who is a merchant.  The couple has two children who are 6 and 11-1/2 years old.  The two adults contribute to family expenses.

Maira specializes in selling cosmetics.  She takes orders from catalogues and then provides the products to her customers.  She sells from home and as a street vendor.  She started the business 7 years ago.  In those days, she experimented with several businesses looking for one that would be profitable.  She realized that selling cosmetics was very profitable and decided to go into this business.

She requested this L10,000 loan to buy lotions and creams.  She hopes that the loan will help her make her business larger.  In the future, she’d like to have her own commercial locale so as not to continue being a street vendor.

loans.use: to buy lotions and creams.

loans.name: María Magdalena

texts.es: María es socia del Banco Comunal Sarita, es viuda, se dedica a la venta de locerías, con los primeros préstamos que recibió compró mercaderías variada, ella distribuye sus productos en casas y vende también en las ferias, con la ayuda de Finca pudo ampliar su negocio, le gusta recibir charlas ya que le es fácil captar porque es bien dinámico, gracias a las capacitaciones aprendió a educar bien a sus hijos, le gusta su Bamconumal porque las socias son bien unidas y se apoyan entre ellas. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en su viaje a la ciudad de Lima para comprar mercaderías y poder surtir su negocio. Su meta es construir su casa de material noble para sus hijos.
texts.en: María is a member of the Sarita communal bank . She is a widow and she sells crockery. With the initial loans that she received, she bought different merchandise. She sells her products in homes and also at fairs. With FINCA's help she has managed to expand her business. She enjoys attending lectures and the dynamism makes them easy to understand. This training has helped her to learn how to raise her children well. She likes her communal bank because the members are very close and they support each other. The loan she is requesting will be invested in the trip she is making to Lima to purchase merchandise to stock her business. Her goal is to build a brick and mortar house for her children.

loans.use: to buy merchandise in Lima.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy es socia del Banco Comunal Esperanza, tiene 32 años, esta casada y es madre de 2 hijos, vende abarrotes en las ferias, es socia de Finca desde hace mas de 1 año, con el primer crédito que recibió compró abarrotes y aumento su mercadería, desde que ingresó a Finca empezó ahorrar, su negocio esta creciendo, le gusta las capacitaciones porque todas las charlas que recibe lo comparte con su familia, el prñestamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de galletas y golosinas. Su meta es comprar un carro para poder transportar su mercadería y seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Nancy is a member of Esperanza Communal Bank.  She is 36 years old and married, and the mother of two children.

She sells groceries in the markets.  She has been a member of Finca for more than a year.  With the first loan she received she bought groceries and increased her merchandise.  Since she became a member of Finca she began to save.  Her business is growing.  She likes the training because she shares with her family all the talks she hears. 

She will use the loan she is requesting to buy cookies and sweets.

Her goal is to buy a car to be able to transport her merchandise and continue growing.

loans.use: to buy cookies and sweets.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel, de 56 años de edad, es una mujer alegre y empeñosa, es conviviente con Manuel, fruto de esa unión tiene tres hijos de 18, 16, y 14 años de edad, a los que quiere mucho, y están cómodamente instalados en su casa propia. La actividad que realiza Isabel, es la venta de comidas como tallarines, saltados de pollos, Juanes, y parrilladas, iniciándose en la venta de comidas en un puesto en el mercado de su ciudad. Pero en la actualidad lo realiza en el frontis de su casa desde hace 9 años, contando con la ayuda de su hija en la preparación y atención de los clientes en sus ratos libre y cuando no está estudiando. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es tener un ingreso económico para poder ayudar a su pareja con los gatos del hogar ya que con lo que gana como refaccionador de calzados  no le alcanzaba para cubrir los gastos de alimentación y educación de sus hijos. Ante esto, decidió iniciarse en la venta de comida, ahora contando con un ingreso se siente más segura de poder progresar, ya que tiene una regular clientela que le consumen sus alimentos, y le deja buenas ganancias, por eso tiene planes de ampliar más su negocio y poder abrir un restaurante en su propia casa. Este será el préstamo número 2 con la institución MFP, por lo que necesita de un apoyo financiero para avanzar con su negocio, se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en créditos anteriores. Por otro lado, se siente a gusto con su grupo, pues los considera personas responsables y amables. Con el monto solicitado de 1,500 nuevos soles, los invertirá en la compra de madera y calaminas, para arreglar el techo de su venta de comidas en su casa, ya que cuando llueve llega a gotear.
texts.en:
Isabel, 56, is a happy and hardworking woman.  She lives with Manuel and from this union has three children, ages 18, 16, and 14, whom she loves very much.  They live comfortably in their own home.

Isabel's work is selling meals such as spaghetti, chicken "saltado" [sauteed meat and vegetables], "juanes" [a type of tamal filled with rice], and barbecue.  She began selling food in a stall in the market of her city, but currently she has been doing it in front of her house for nine years.  She has the help of her daughter preparing the food and waiting on customers in her spare time and when she is not studying. 

What she likes about her work is having an economic income to be able to help her partner with the household expenses, because what he earns repairing shoes is not enough to cover the expenses to feed and educate their children.  Faced with this, she decided to start the food business and now has an income.  She feels more secure about being able to make progress, since she has regular customers who eat her meals, and it gives her a good profit.  This is why she has plans to expand her business more and be able to open a restaurant in her own house.

This will be her second loan with the MFP institution.  She needs financial support to get ahead with her business.  She is committed to making her payments, as with previous loans.  On the other hand, she feels comfortable with her group since she considers them responsible and kind people.

With the requested amount of 1,500 PEN she will buy wood and corrugated iron to fix the roof of her food stall, since it begins to leak when it rains.

loans.use: to buy wood and corrugated iron to fix the roof of her food stall.

loans.name: Alvaro Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Álvaro a sus 43 años de edad, se dedica a la agricultura. Actualmente tiene cultivos de aguacate y cilantro en terrenos de propiedad familiar. El Señor Álvaro dedica su tiempo libre a los cultivos ya que también él trabaja como operario agrícola en un cultivo de flores en el municipio del Carmen de Viboral ubicado al oriente de Antioquia. El señor Álvaro cuenta con muchos años de experiencia en el oficio puesto que pertenece a una familia de agricultores.
El señor Álvaro tiene dos hijos de 15 y 6 años de edad; el menor de sus hijos tiene una enfermedad en el colón y requiere de una cirugía y del consumo de medicinas muy costosas. 
Actualmente, el señor Álvaro desea sembrar palos de aguacate y de esta manera seguir creciendo con su actividad, por tanto podrá generar otros ingresos para el sustento familiar. El señor Álvaro sueña con ver a su hijo recuperado de la enfermedad que tiene y continuar trabajando para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y educación.
texts.en:
Sr. Álvaro, 43, is a farmer. Currently he is growing avocados and cilantro on family land. He dedicates his free time to his own farming since he also works as a farm laborer in flower cultivation in the municipality of Carmen de Viboral, located east of Antioquia. He has many years of experience in this work since he belongs to a family of farmers.

Álvaro has two sons, 15 and 6 years old. The youngest of his sons has a disease of the colon that requires surgery and very expensive medication.

At present, Álvaro wants to plant more avocados and continue growing as a farmer so that he will be able to generate additional income to support his family. He dreams of seeing his son recovered from his the illness and of continuing to work to give his family an education and a  better quality of life.

loans.use: to plant avocados.

loans.name: Getsemani Group

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Graciela es casada, tiene 44 años D. edad, estudio la educación primaria, tiene 2 hilos los cuales no estudian, se dedica a la confección D. tejidos, inicio este trabajo como operaria, y hasta el momento lleva 10 años D. experiencia, cuanta con el apoyo D. su esposo quien se dedica a la mecánica D. autos.

Organiza un grupo para solicitar un préstamo que le servirá para la compra D. telas e hilos, espera en el futuro su negocio sea granD.. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedica a la tejeduría, venta D. papalinas, crianza D. animales, bordado, sastrería y al comercio.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosa Graciela is married, 44, and has a primary education. She has two sons who are no longer in school.  She makes woven goods and began this work as an employee. She has ten years of experience and has the support of her husband who is an auto mechanic.

She has organized this communal bank in order to request a loan that she will use to buy fabric and thread. She hopes that her business will expand in the future. The other members of the group work in weaving, the sale of sunbonnets, raising animals, embroidery, tailoring and traD..

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Mariana Del Consuelo

texts.es:
