texts.en: Vladimir is a single man.  He owns a car that he uses to operate a taxi service.  He's working day and night to pay for a small house that he wants in case he decides to have a family one day.  Without a house, he and any family that he has would have to live in an "anticretico" [a rental-purchase arrangement common in Bolivia] or a rented house.  He is applying for a loan to buy a large supply of gasoline, something that will allow him to reduce his fuel costs.  Gasoline prices are more expensive by the day, so buying a wholesale supply of gasoline will allow him to reduce his costs, increase his income and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy gasoline wholesale

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
Claudia nació en la  ciudad de Urubamba provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco y ahora vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, ella tiene 56 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene cuatro hijos.
 
Claudia desarrolla sus actividades cotidianas y económicas en la ciudad de Urubamba, ella es proveedora de materiales de construcción en la ciudad de Urubamba. Ya son siete años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

Claudia requiere el préstamo para comprar mas mercadería como por ejemplo arena, cemento, piedra chancada y otras cosas más.  

Claudia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma. Claudia pertenece al banco comunal “Tercer Milenio” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad de Urubamba.
texts.en:
Claudia, 56, was born in Urubamba, a city in the Peruvian "departamento" of Cusco.  She still lives there with her husband and their four children.
 
Claudia owns a construction materials sales business in Urubamba.  She has operated the business for seven years and has worked hard to make it a success.

Claudia wants a loan to buy merchandise--sand, cement, and gravel, for example--that she will resell.

Claudia is grateful for the opportunities that this type of lending provides and is committed to repaying her loan in the agreed-upon time.  She belongs to the Tercer Milenio community bank, an Asociacion Arariwa partner in Urubamba.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for construction materials business.

loans.name: Santusa

texts.es:
Santusa nació en la  ciudad D. Urubamba provincia D. Urubamba del departamento del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donD. nació, ella tiene 60 años D. edad y es casada y fruto D. esta unión tiene cinco hijos.
 
Santusa desarrolla sus actividades cotidianas y económicas en la ciudad D. Urubamba, ella es profesora y trabaja en uno D. los colegios más prestigiosos D. la ciudad D. Urubamba. Ya son varios años que se dedica a enseñar y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

Santusa requiere el préstamo para uso personal para la educación D. sus hijos. 

Santusa se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma. Santusa pertenece al banco comunal “Tercer Milenio” D. la Asociación Arariwa D. la ciudad D. Urubamba.
texts.en:
Santusa, 60, was born in Urubamba, a city in the Peruvian "departamento" of Cusco.  She still lives there with her husband and their five children.
 
Santusa is a teacher at the most prestigious school in Urubamba.  She has been a teacher for several years and her income from the job has provided her with a good living.

Santusa will use this loan to pay her children's school fees.

Santusa is grateful for the opportunities that this type of lending provides and is committed to repaying her loan in the agreed-upon time.  She belongs to the Tercer Milenio community bank, an Asociacion Arariwa partner in Urubamba.

loans.use: to pay her children's school fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 3 computers

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
Josefina nació en el distrito de Huayllabamba de la provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco y ahora vive en la ciudad de Urubamba, ella tiene 65 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene cinco hijos.
 
Josefina desarrolla sus actividades cotidianas y económicas en la ciudad de Urubamba, ella se dedica  a la venta de chicha de quinua en uno de los mercados populares de la ciudad de Urubamba. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

Josefina requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como sacos de azúcar, sacos de quinua y otras cosas más. 

Josefina se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma. Josefina pertenece al banco comunal “Tercer Milenio” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad de Urubamba.
texts.en:
Josefina, 65, was born in Huayllabamba, a district in the Peruvian "departamento" of Cusco.  She now lives in the city of Urubamba with her husband and their five children.
 
Josefina operates a drinks business in Urubamba.  She sell "chicha de quinua" [a traditional quinoa-based drink] in one of Urubamba's most important markets.

Josefina will use this loan to buy supplies--sugar, quinoa, etc.--for her drinks business.

Josefina is grateful for the opportunities that this type of lending provides and is committed to repaying her loan in the agreed-upon time.  She belongs to the Tercer Milenio community bank, an Asociacion Arariwa partner in Urubamba.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her drinks business.

loans.name: Mauro Juvenal

texts.es:
Juvenal nació en el distrito de Urubamba de la provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, ella tiene 75 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene tres hijos.
 
Juvenal desarrolla sus actividades cotidianas y económicas en la ciudad de Urubamba, él es cesante de educación pero continua enseñando en un colegio particular en la ciudad de Urubamba, él también tiene un pequeño negocio familiar que consiste en la venta de comida, desayunos y refrigerios. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

Juvenal requiere el préstamo para el mejoramiento de la cocina del restaurante.  

Juvenal se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma. Juvenal pertenece al banco comunal “Tercer Milenio” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad de Urubamba.
texts.en:
Juvenal was born in the district of Urubamba, in the province of Urubamba, department of Cusco, and he currently lives in the same city where he was born.  He is 75 years old, married, and has three children.  

Juvenal carries out his daily economic activities in the city of Urubamba.  He was laid off from his job as a teacher but continues to teach at a secondary school in Urubamba.  He also has a small family business that involves selling meals, breakfasts, and light refreshments.  He has already been operating this business for several years, and it is going well thanks to the effort he has put into his work.

Juvenal needs the loan in order to improve the kitchen at his restaurant.

Juvenal is grateful for the opportunity that this loan provides, and he promises to make all of the payments on time.  Juvenal belongs to the “Tercer Milenio” communal bank, which works with Asociación Arariwa in the city of Urubamba.

loans.use: to improve the kitchen at his restaurant.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children.  Rebecca has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, & beverages . She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks ,& beverages.  Rebecca has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Rebecca hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, & beverages

loans.name: Daylinda

texts.en: Daylinda is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 10 children. Daylinda has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, & beverages.   She has had this business for 20 years. She requested a loan of PHP 16,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, & beverages.  Daylinda has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Daylinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Armandina

texts.es:
Armandina nació en el distrito de Urubamba de la provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, ella tiene 39 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene dos hijos.
 
Armandina desarrolla sus actividades cotidianas y económicas en la ciudad de Urubamba, ella tiene una pequeña librería donde vende útiles de escritorio y otras cosas más. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

Armandina requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo cuadernos, lapiceros y otras cosas más. 

Armandina se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma. Armandina pertenece al banco comunal “Tercer Milenio” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad de Urubamba.
texts.en:
Armandina was born in the district of Urubamba in the province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco and she lives in the same city where she was born. She is 39 years old and is married and from this marriage she has two children.

Armandina’s daily work takes place in the city of Urubamba. She has a little bookstore where she sells stationery and other items. She has been doing this for several years and her business is going very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work.

Armandina is asking for a loan in order to buy merchandise such as notebooks, pens and other items. 

Armandina is grateful for the opportunity this loan gives her and she promises to make her payment according to the schedule. Armandina belongs to the communal bank Tercer Milenio of the Asociación Arariwa in the city of Urubamba.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as notebooks, pens and other items

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard, age 24 and unmarried, is a fish vendor. He runs a shop that offers a variety of fish for sale, such as sardines and mackerel. He has operated his business for two years.

Richard joined HSPFI earlier this year. His goal is to make improvements to his business.

He has requested a loan in the amount of PHP 8,000 in order to buy fish to offer for sale.

loans.use: to buy fish to offer for sale

loans.name: Ricky

texts.en:
Ricky is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with two children.
 
Ricky has a computer shop that provides computer games and internet.  He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy tools and pay for the electricity of his computer shop.

Ricky has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Ricky hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the electricity of his computer shop.

loans.name: Emerita

texts.en:
Emerita is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children.
 
Emerita has a computer shop that provides internet and computer games. She has had this business for eight years. She requested a loan for PHP 17,000 to buy tools and pay for the electricity of her computer shop.

Emerita has been a member of HSPFI since 2009.  In the future, Emerita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the electricity of her computer shop.

loans.name: Mae Jean

texts.en:
Mae Jean is 24 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single with one child. 

Mae Jean has a computer shop that provides internet and online games. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for PHP 17,000 to buy tools and pay for the electricity for her internet shop.

Mae Jean has been a member of HSPFI since 2009.  In the future, Mae Jean hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the electricity for her internet shop.

loans.name: John Paul

texts.en:
John Paul is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single with two children. 

John Paul has a computer shop that provides online games and internet. He has had this business for three years. He requested a loan for PHP 17,000 to buy tools and pay for the electricity for his computer shop.

John Paul has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, John Paul hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the electricity for his computer shop.

loans.name: Felicita Del Socorro

texts.es:
Felicita, casada, madre de 4 hijos, es maestra de educación primaria y comerciante tiene una pulpería en su casa de habitación, ella vive en Quezalguaque municipio de León. Ella inicio su primer negocio haciendo pasteles que ella misma elaboraba, luego tuvo la iniciativa de poner una pequeña pulpería porque los ingresos en su hogar era muy pocos y no le ajustaba, recuerda que comenzó vendiendo 50 libras de frijoles, de azúcar, arroz , después vendía aceite pero con el tiempo fue creciendo y comprando nuevos productos. De esta manera combina su actividad como maestras y comerciante.
Ella requiere el préstamo para comprar carne, pollo, aceite, productos de limpieza y que estos productos son los que vende mas rápido y carece mas la población de su zona. Uno de sus planes  introducir a su pulpería cosméticos como shampoo, jabones para cuerpo, cremas, desodorantes y la venta de ropa.
texts.en:
Felicita is married and has four children. She is an elementary school teacher and a merchant. She has a small store in her home. She lives in the Quezalguaque municipality of Leon. She started her first business selling cakes that she made herself. She then took the initiative to open a small store because her household's income was quite low. She remembers that she started off selling 50 pounds of beans, sugar, and rice. Later she started selling oil, and with time her business has grown and she has bought new products. Therefore, she works both as a teacher and as a merchant.
She needs this loan for the purchase of meat, chicken, oil, and cleaning products. These are the products that she sells off the most quickly and are most needed by the people in that area. One of her plans is to open a small cosmetics store, selling items such as shampoo, soap, cream, deodorant, and clothing.

loans.use: to buy meat, chicken, oil, and cleaning products.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Luz has a computer shop that provides internet and online games. The picture was taken outside her house. She has had this business for five years.  She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy tools and pay for the electricity for her computer shop.

Luz has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Luz hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the electricity for her computer shop.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 52 years old and lives in Tinago, Ozamis City. She is married with three children. 

To earn a living, Virgina has a business selling snacks like cakes and pastries. She earns about 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. Virginia has requested a loan to purchase ingredients for her bakery business.

Virginia has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Virginia would like to save money for the future.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her bakery business.

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.en:
Rodrigo is 60 years old and lives in the Philippines.  He is married with five children. 

Rodrigo has a shop that sells electronic phone loads from several networks. He is also engaged in a networking business called UNIGOSYO. He has had this business for five years. He has requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy stocks of electronic phone loads to sell.

Rodrigo has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Rodrigo hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of electronic phone loads to sell.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with four children.
 
Eduardo has a shop that sells electronic phone loads from several networks.  He is also engaging in a networking business called UNIGOSYO.  He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy stocks of electronic phone loads to sell.

Eduardo has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Eduardo hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of electronic phone loads to sell.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 63 years old and lives in Goaw, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with four children.

To earn a living, Alicia has a business selling a variety of foods for snacks. She earns about 2,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. Alicia has requested a loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase ingredients for her snack-vending business.

Alicia has been a member of PMPC for more than a year. In the future, Alicia would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her snack-vending business.

loans.name: Maria Theresa

texts.en:
Maria Theresa is 41-years-old and lives in Poblacion 1, Clarin,Misamis Occidental. She is married with 3 children. 

Maria Theresa has a business that sells a variety of dried fish. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan of PHP 50,000  to purchase a variety of dried fish.

Maria Theresa has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Maria Theresa hopes to expand business to nearby localities.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of dried fish.

loans.name: Geneveve

texts.en:
Geneveve is 24 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 

Geneveve has a shop that sells electronic loads (prepaid phone cards) from several networks like GLOBE & SMART. She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan for 7,000 PHP to buy stocks of electronic loads. Geneveve has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. 

In the future, Geneveve hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of electronic loads (prepaid phone cards)

loans.name: Ruperta

texts.en:
Ruperta is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 

Ruperta has a shop that sells electronic loads (prepaid phone cards) of several networks like GLOBE & SMART. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 7,000 PHP to buy stocks of electronic loads. Ruperta has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. 

In the future, Ruperta hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of electronic loads (prepaid phone cards)

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 

Marites has a shop that sells electronic loads (prepaid phone cards) from several networks like GLOBE & SMART. She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan for 7,000 PHP to buy stocks of electronic loads. Marites has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. 

In the future, Marites hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of electronic loads (prepaid phone cards)

loans.name: Prudencio

texts.en: Prudencio  is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single.  Prudencio has a shop that sells electronic loads from several networks. He is also engaging in a networking business called UNIGOSYO.  He has had this business for 5 years. He requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy stock of electronic loads.  Prudencio has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Prudencio  hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of electronic loads

loans.name: Miraluna

texts.en:
Miraluna is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 

Miraluna has a shop that sells electronic loads (prepaid phone cards) from several networks. She has had this business for 5 years. She is also engaging in networking businesses like UNIGOSYO & PERSONAL CARE. She requested a loan for 7,000 PHP to buy stocks of electronic loads for sale.

Miraluna has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Miraluna hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of electronic loads (prepaid phone cards)

loans.name: Lorgia Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Lorgia, de 55 años edad, vive en León,   es comerciante, vende tortillas, ropa y cosméticos la cual tiene ubicada en la entrada de su casa , es casada, tiene tres hijos. Inicio su negocio a los 29 años de edad cuando solo se dedicaba a elaborar y vender tortillas pero necesitaba generar mas ingresos para ayudar a su esposo fue entonces que invirtió en cosméticos y ropa para vender para conseguir otros ingresos para su hogar su esposo la ayudo desde el principio, ya lleva 5 años que vender ropa y cosméticos le ha resultado muy rentable. Ella requiere el préstamo para comprar ropa y cosméticos para aprovechar las ventas navideñas. Pues quiere poner una pulpería en la que pueda vender ropa y cosméticos.
texts.en: Mrs. Lorgia, age 55, lives in Leon. She is a merchant and sells tortillas, clothing and cosmetics from her home. She is married with three children. She started her business when she was 29, just making tortillas--but she needed to generate more income to help her husband, so she invested in cosmetics and clothing. Her husband has helped her from the beginning. She has now sold clothing and cosmetics for five years, and this has been very profitable for her. She needs this loan to buy clothing and cosmetics in order to take advantage of the Christmas season. She wants to have a store from which to sell her clothing and cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy clothing and cosmetics.

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
Melba is married with 5 children. Melba is 50-years-old and lives in Loay, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.

Melba owns a sari-sari store to earn a living and has had this business for 11 years. Each month, she earns PHP 5000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 20000 to purchase more stocks for her general store.

Melba has been a member of PMPC for more than 1 year. In the future, Melba hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks for her general store.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 2 children. 

Bernard has a shop that sells electronic loads (prepaid phone cards) of several networks like GLOBE & SMART. He has had this business for 5 years. He requested a loan for 7,000 PHP to buy stocks of electronic loads. Bernard has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. 

In the future, Bernard hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of electronic loads (prepaid phone cards)

loans.name: Zenaidah

texts.en:
Zenaidah is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children.
 
Zenaidah has a shop that sells electronic phone loads from several networks such as GLOBE and SMART.  She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy stocks of electronic phone loads to sell.

Zenaidah has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Zenaidah hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of electronic phone loads to sell.

loans.name: Mach

texts.en: Mach, 47, is married and resides with her husband. Machand her husband raise piglets to resell when they are three months old. Mach is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase pig food to feed the pigs. By doing so, her family is able to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy pig food to feed piglets.

loans.name: Savan

texts.en: Savan, 27, is married and resides with her husband. Savan sells fish, and her husband is a construction worker. Mach is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase more fish to expand her fish selling business. By doing so, her family is able to generate more incomes. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more fish to resell.

loans.name: Mark Jhon

texts.en:
Mark Jhon is 18 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single. 

Mark Jhon provides motorcycle or habal-habal services. He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the maintenance of his motorcycle.

Mark Jhon has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Mark Jhon hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the maintenance of his motorcycle.

loans.name: Raul

texts.en:
Raul is married with 5 children. Raul is 38-years-old and lives in New Bethlehem, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

Raul sells toyo to earn a living and  had this business for 4 years. Each month, he earns PHP 15000 doing this type of work. He has requested a loan for PHP 20000 to purchase 20 gallons of soy sauce to sell/retail.

Raul has been a member of PMPC this year 2011. In the future, Raul hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase 20 gallons of  soy sauce to sell/retail.

location.town: New Bethlehem, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Brigido

texts.en:
Brigido is a simple farmer with simple dreams in life.  He has been planting rice crops in his one hectare of rice fields for 31 years. He is married with three children.  Of his three children, two of them are settled in marriage and live separately, while the youngest is still studying. 

Brigido works hard to sustain his family's daily needs and to send his youngest child to a higher level of education.  He plans to increase his rice production so that he can generate greater profits every crop season.  Brigido has been spending his income on his family's daily needs; children's allowance; electricity bills; irrigation fees and his obligations to traders who have high interest rates.  Thus, to avoid having debts to traders with high rates, Brigido is requesting a loan of PHP 30,000 which would allow him to purchase farm supplies from traders with low interest rates to improve his farming business. This would mean a lot to him, because he could proviD. the necessary plant care for his rice crops.  He hopes to have an ongoing partnership with the lenders so that he can support his youngest child pursue his studies.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies for his farming business.

loans.name: Norma Del Socorro

texts.es:
Norma, de 47 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de León, es comerciante se dedica la venta de artesanías, es viuda, madre de 6 hijos. Sus comienzo fuero difíciles cuando quedo viuda emigro a Costa Rica en busca de una oportunidad de trabajo que le ayudara a solventar los gastos de manutención de sus 6 hijos, trabajo de domestica cuando regreso  a su tierra se propuso tener su propio negocio para no tener que trabajarle a nadie invirtió en la venta de artesanía poco a poco su negocio que empezó con 5 piezas de artesanías ahora distribuye fuera de su ciudad y vende a Costa Rica con este negocio termino de criar a sus hijos para que no les hiciera falta nada.  
Ella requiere el préstamo para comprar artesanías para aumentar el volumen de ventas. Pues su visión de futuro es poner una tienda de artesanía con la capacidad de exportar fuera de Nicaragua a los países vecinos
texts.en:
Norma, age 47, lives in Leon. She is a merchant and sells crafts. She is a widow and has six children. In the beginning things were difficult for her. When she was widowed, she emigrated to Costa Rica in search of work so that she could provide for her six children. She worked as a maid. When she returned home she decided to have her own business so that she wouldn't have to work for anyone. She invested in selling crafts, starting with only five pieces. Her business grew bit by bit. She now distributes outside of her city and sells to Costa Rica. This business will last her until her children are grown and allow her to ensure that they lack nothing.
She needs this loan for the purchase of crafts to increase her sales. Her vision for the future is to open a craft store with the capacity to export outside of Nicaragua, to the neighbouring countries.

loans.use: to buy crafts

loans.name: Vicente

texts.en:
Vicente is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 10 children. 
Vicente has a shop that makes & sells furniture like beds, cabinets & tables. He has had this business for 10 years. He requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy wood & materials needed for making furniture.
Vicente has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Vicente hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy wood & materials needed for making furniture

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 3 children.

Rogelio has a shop that makes and sells bamboo sun breakers (blinds). He has had this business for 5 years. He requested a loan for 7,000 PHP to buy materials needed in making bamboo sun breakers.

Rogelio has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Rogelio hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed in making bamboo sun breakers

loans.name: Netra

texts.en: Netra, 22, is married and resides with her husband in Battambong Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality rice products. Netra and her husband are goldsmiths. They also sell jewelry. Netra is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase more jewelry to resell. By doing so, her family is able to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to purchase more jewelry to resell

loans.name: Puthea

texts.en: Puthea, 31, is married and resides with his wife in Battambong Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality rice products. Puthea is a blacksmith, and his wife sells desserts at a local market in the city. Putheais is requesting a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase a motorbike to commute to work. By doing so, his family is able to decrease the expenses of public transportation. In the future, he would like to use any additional income to repair his house. This will be his first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to commute to work

loans.name: Ramil

texts.en:
Ramil is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 6 children.

Ramil has a shop that makes and sells bamboo sun breakers, which are for creating a shield to avoid direct sunlight. He has had this business for 5 years. He requested a loan for 7,000 PHP to buy materials needed for making bamboo sun breakers.

Ramil has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Ramil hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for making bamboo sun breakers

loans.name: Rey

texts.en:
Rey is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 2 children.
 
Rey has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. He has had this business for 5 years. He requested a loan for 7,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Rey has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Rey hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Sinob

texts.en:
Sinob (in the photo) is 25 years old and his wife, Phallin, is 24 years old. They live in a village about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2008 and have one young daughter. 

Sinob and his wife are farmers. They grow beans and cauliflower on their farmland in the village where they live. Sinob is asking for his first loan in the amount of $700 to buy seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his farm.

loans.use: to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his farm

loans.name: Sovan

texts.en:
Sovan is a widow with two sons and one daughter; one is married; another is a fisherman, and the other is in school. Sovan lives in a village about 20 kilometers south of Phnom Penh City. She sells flowers and bananas, purchasing her goods from fellow villagers and selling them in a Phnom Penh market.

Sovan’ married son would like to build his own house to live in. Sovan is therefore requesting a loan in the amount of $600 to help her son’s project.

loans.use: to build a house for her son.

loans.name: Martha Del Socorro

texts.es:
Martha, de 48 años de edad, es comerciante, tiene una pulpería, vive en la ciudad de León, madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos, ya son independientes. El negocio de la pulpería lo heredo de su madre quien era comerciante pero su madre la dejo a ella administrando el negocio y que se ayudara para pagar los gastos de sus hijos ya que le toco ser madre soltera y no tuvo mas apoyo  que el de su mama. Hoy en día es ella quien es dueña y administradora de su  pulpería a cual ha ido creciendo poco a poco y por la cual le dio lo necesario a sus hijos para que no pasaran hambre. 
Ella realizo el préstamo para comprar ropa, zapatos, chinelas y adornos alusivos a la navidad y productos varios para vender y mejorar la calidad de su servicio y productos para ofrecer a sus clientes. Ella nos cuenta que piensa comprar un freezer nuevo y dos vitrinas para su negocio e ir mejorando poco a poco.
texts.en:
Martha, age 48, is a merchant and has a small store. She lives in Leon. She is the single mother of two independent children. She inherited her store from her mother, who gave her the business so that she could support her children. Martha is a single mother and her mother is her only support. She is now the owner and administrator of the store, which has grown bit by bit. Through this business, she has been able to provide for her children and ensure that they never went hungry.
She is taking out this loan for the purchase of clothing, shoes, slippers, Christmas decorations, and other products to sell so that she can improve her service and offer more products to her customers. She tells us that she also plans to buy a new freezer and two display cases for her business, so that she can improve bit by bit.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, slippers, and Christmas decorations.

loans.name: Corazon Group

texts.en:
Corazon is 66 years old and lives in Gango, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She is a widow with three adult-aged children. Corazon has a shop that sells canned goods, soap, toothpaste, noodles, etc. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of PHP 17,000 to purchase more canned goods, soap, toothpaste, noodles, etc. Corazon has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Corazon hopes to save money for future emergencies.

Corazon is the leader of a three person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: to use to purchase canned goods, soap, toothpaste, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Sothy

texts.en:
Sothy (pictured with her loom) is a weaver, while her husband Him is a house constructor. They live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh and have one son and two daughters.

Sothy hopes to continue her weaving business because it’s a traditional professional business, so she is asking for another loan of $600 to purchase weaving materials.

loans.use: to buy weaving material for her weaving business.

loans.name: Ma. Estrella

texts.en:
Ma. Estrella is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 

Ma. Estrella has a beauty shop that provides hair cutting, styling, pedicures and manicures. She has had this business for 20 years. She requested a loan for 7,000 PHP to buy materials needed for the beauty salon.

Ma. Estrella has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Ma. Estrella hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for the beauty salon

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Sokha (in the photo) lives along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penn City. She is a widow with one son and two daughters- one is in school and the others assist their mother in the business. 

Sokha sells jasmine flowers. She buys jasmine flowers from her village and transports them to sell in the market, located in Phnom Penh. Sokha asked for a Kiva loan once. She is now asking for her second loan in the amount of 1,000 USD to continue her business by purchasing jasmine flowers under contract for resale.

loans.use: to buy flowers under contract for resale

loans.name: Sorphea

texts.en:
Sorphea (in the photo) is single and lives with her widowed mother in a village about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sorphea sells clothes. She buys clothes from the market located in Phnom Penh and sells them in front of the garment factory. She is asking for a loan in the amount of 1,000 USD to expand her business by purchasing additional clothes for sale.

loans.use: to purchase additional clothes for sale

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
Rufina is 54 years old and lives in Punta, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with five children. 
Rufina works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan to purchase fish to sell for her fish vending business. 
Rufina has been a member of PMPC for 11 years. In the future, Rufina hopes to expand her business in the town.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell for her fish vending business.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with 6 children. 

Helen has a shop that sells electronic loads (prepaid phone cards) from several networks. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy electronic loads for sale.

Helen has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Helen hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy electronic loads (prepaid phone cards)

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Srey (pictured above) and her husband, Thon, live across the Mekong River about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have two sons and one daughter. The daughter is married and lives outside of the family home and other two attend school. 

Srey sells beef, while her husband is a farmer and raises cows at home. Srey’s daughter, who is married, also sells beef. She buys beef from the slaughterhouse and transports it by bicycle to sell in the local market. She now wants to purchase a motorbike, but she does not have money. Hence Srey decided to request another loan in the mount of 1,000 USD to purchase a motorbike for her daughter to carry beef to market.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her daughter to carry beef to market

loans.name: Phally

texts.en: Phally, 31, is married and resides with her husband in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. Phally is employed at the factory, and her husband is a construction worker. Phally is requesting a loan of USD 300 to purchase fertilizers and rice seeds to do farming. By doing so, her family is able to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and rice seeds to farm

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 
Lorna has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to bU. canned goods, snacks and beverages.
Lorna has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Chanra

texts.en:
Chanra is 52 years old and her husband, Sarin, is 54 years old. They live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1980 and have three sons and two daughters. One is married, one is a hairdresser, another is a construction worker, and the other two are in school.

Chanra sells groceries at home, while her husband is a farmer. She is asking for a loan of $500 to make a new door for her house because the door is old and broken. She will use part of the loan to help with her daughter’s hairdressing business by buying materials such as a blow dryer, rollers, and so on.

loans.use: To make a new door for her house and buy materials for her daughter’s hairdressing business.

loans.name: Marcilina

texts.en:
Marcilina is married with four children. Marcilina is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Marcilina is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. She has requested a loan of 14,900 Philippines pesos (PHP) to  purchase additional pigs to raise. 

Marcilina has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Marcilina hopes to improve their residential house.

loans.use: to purchase additional pigs to raise.

loans.name: Sambath

texts.en: Sambath, 41, is married and resides with her husband in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. Sambath is a cleaner at a gas station and her husband is a soldier. Sambath is requesting a loan of US $500 to repair her house. This will be her second loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to repair her house

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single and has 3 children.

Mary Joy has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Mary Joy has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Mary Joy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Sy

texts.en: Sy, 47, is married and resides with her husband in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. Sy is a farmer and her husband is a teacher in a local school. Sy is requesting a loan of US $500 to purchase rice to stock and then sell when the price is profitable. By doing so, her family will be able to generate more income. In the future, Sy would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to purchase rice to stock and resell

loans.name: Lavinia

texts.en:
Lavinia is 66 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed and has five children.

Lavinia has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Lavinia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Lavinia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Sokhorn

texts.en: Sokhorn, 47, is married and resides with her husband in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. Sokhorn and her husband sell fish. Sokhorn is requesting a loan of US $500 to purchase a motorbike to transport fish to sell. By doing so, her family will be able to decrease their expenses for public transportation. In the future, Sokhorn would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to transport fish to sell

loans.name: Karen

texts.en: Karen is 38 years old and lives in Mobod, Oroquieta City. She is married and has 3 children. Karen has a clothing sales business, earning about PHP 5,000 each month. Karen has a requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase fabric for her clothing business. Karen has been a member of PMPC for a year.  In the future, Karen would like to have merchandise to earn money.

loans.use: to purchase fabric for her clothing business

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina 38, is a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Augusto, a tricycle driver, and has a 6-year-old daughter currently studying in grade one. While attending to her husband and daughter, Carolina also keeps busy with her business as her way of helping her husband with the family's daily expenses. 

Carolina owns a variety store. She buys groceries such as canned goods, condiments, milk, sugar and primary commodities needed in every household. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house and her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day. Her husband’s income in his tricycle business is also a big help. 

To help her continue operations of her business, Carolina is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan, which she will use to buy more grocery items to increase her stock. The more items displayed at the store the better, as it helps to attract more customers to buy from her. More sales will result in better profit and will help her to save more money for her future. 

Carolina hopes that her business will maintain good income and become a grocery someday. It would also be a great help to have an additional tricycle.  Carolina dreams of maintaining enough income to send her daughter to a good school and for her to be able to finish college, have work and a stable life. Carolina is active in attending the weekly fellowship* as it helps to learn a lot from the Bible. Before becoming a member of CCT, Carolina never opened her Bible, but she does now as it strengthens her spiritual life.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Monina

texts.en:
Monina is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children.

Monina has a pigpen where she raises and matures pigs for sale. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy animal feed for the pigs.

Monina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Monina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Mae

texts.en:
Mae is 33 years old, married and has one child. She lives in Looc Proper, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental.

To earn a living, Mae has been selling clothing for the past five years. Each month, she earns PHP 4,000. She is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase more ready-to-wear clothing to sell.

Mae has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Mae hopes to save for the education of her son.

loans.use: To purchase ready-to-wear clothes for her business.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: María, vive en la ciudad de León, tiene 40 años de edad, es comerciante, vende ropa y calzado, casada, tiene 3 hijos. Ella inicio con  su negocio  a los 16 años de edad su madre  le enseño ya que vendía zapatos y poco a poco fue adquiriendo experiencia hasta lograr tener su negocio propio. Hoy en día vende ropa y zapato que compra en Honduras y en la ciudad de Managua y vende en la ciudad de León pues le gusta que su tienda ofrezca variedad. Ella requiere el préstamo para comprar ropa y zapatos para ofrecer a sus clientes durante la época navideña donde las ventas tiendas a elevarse un poco y las ganancias son buenas.  Una de sus metas es lograr entrar a comercializar sus ropas en el Salvador.
texts.en: María lives in Leon. She is 40 and works as a merchant, selling clothing and shoes. She has three children. She started her business when she was 16; her mother taught her, as she used to sell shoes. Bit by bit, Maria gained enough experience to run her own business. She now sells clothing and shoes which she buys in Honduras, in the city of Managua. She sells her products in Leon. She is happy to offer a variety of products. She needs this loan to purchase shoes and clothing to offer her customers during the Christmas season, when sales are a bit higher and earnings are good. One of her goals is to sell her clothing in El Salvador.

loans.use: to buy clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has six children.

Gloria has a food shop or carenderia (eatery) that sells tasty dishes like adobo chicken and fried chicken. She has had this business for 21 years. She has requested a loan for 7,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients for making tasty foods to sell.

Gloria has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Gloria hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making tasty foods to sell.

loans.name: Savun

texts.en:
Savun, 48, is married and resides with her husband in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. 

Savun sells fish and her husband produces wooden furniture. Savun is requesting a loan to purchase more wood for her husband to produce wooden furniture to sell. By doing so, her family is able to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy wood for her husband to produce wooden furniture.

loans.name: Salve

texts.en:
Salve is 43 years old and lives in Purok 3 Gango, Ozamiz City. She is married with three children. 

Salve has a buy & sell business and earns approximately PHP 7,000 each month doing this type of business. She has a requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase more dried fish for her retail business. 

Salve has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Salve hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish for her retail business.

loans.name: Nora Jean

texts.en:
Nora Jean is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Nora Jean has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Nora Jean has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Nora Jean hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Sokhouch

texts.en: Sokhouch, 27, is married and resides with her husband in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. Sokhouch is employed at the factory and her husband is a construction worker. Sokhouchis requesting a loan to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to repair her house.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 42 years old and lives in Ponong, Larena, Siquijor.  She is married with six children.

Analyn sells food and earns approximately PHP 2,500 each month doing this type of work. She requested a loan amounting to PHP 20,000 to purchase assorted ingredients for food vending. Analyn is a new member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. She would like to expand her business and she is hoping that her children will be able to finish studying.

loans.use: to purchase assorted ingredients for food vending.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin has been in the farming business for almost 25 years. He plants his farm with corn crops.He is 56 years old and married with five children. It is through farming that he was able to earn an income to provide for his family needs. 

Benjamin would like to request a loan of PHP 27,000 which will be used to buy necessary materials for his farming business. He believes that through his sacrifices and proper management of his corn farm he could become a successful farmer someday. In addition, he could also send his children to a higher level of education and save some money for emergency purposes.

loans.use: to buy materials necessary for his farming business

loans.name: Abner

texts.en:
This is Abner, who is 39 years old and a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. He is married to Adilie, 32, with one child currently studying in elementary school.  He keeps himself busy attending to his family and business. He wants to proviD. a comfortable life for his family. 

Abner maintains a tricycle business. He owns and drives a tricycle (a motorcycle with sidecar) that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. He starts working as early as 5 in the morning and works until 11 in the evening. There are times when he drives from the late evening until the wee hours of the morning in order to earn a bigger profit. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of PHP 700 in his transportation business every day.

To help him continue the operation of his business, Abner is requesting a loan of PHP 18,000. He will use the loan to buy motorcycle parts for the maintenance of his tricycle unit. He has to maintain his unit in good condition in order to have a regular income for the daily needs of his family. 

Abner dreams of being able to give all his family a good and high quality education through all his hard work. He also aspires to own an additional unit that he can mobilize in the community. He faithfully attends the weekly fellowship* that allows him to know more of God’s word. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly bA.. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the spare parts and maintenance of his tricycle (motorcycle with sidecar).

loans.name: Ritchel

texts.en:
Richel is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married.

Richel has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Richel has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Richel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Menn

texts.en:
Menn is a weaver. Her husband, Savoeun sells cotton and silk fabrics. He buys these fabrics from a weaver in the village, and he transports the fabrics to sell in other provinces.

Menn and her husband have been married since 1979 and have one son and three daughters. One is married and lives in a separate home, and the others have full-time employment. They live in Kbal Kosh, an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Menn is asking for her first loan in the amount of $1,200 to buy a motorcycle for her son to get work. 

Photo: Menn and her husband.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her son to get work.

loans.name: Sokny

texts.en: Sokny, 32, is married and resides with her husband in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. Sokny and her husband sell palm sugar to their new and existing customers. Sokny is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase more palm sugar to resell. By doing so, her family will be able to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more palm sugar to resell

loans.name: Lenie

texts.en:
Lenie is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Lenie has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Lenie has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Lenie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Nym

texts.en: Nym, 24, is married and resides with her husband in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. Nym is employed at a factory and her husband is a construction worker. Nym is requesting a loan of US $600 to purchase groceries to sell when she stops working at the garment factory. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Charo Mae

texts.en: Charo Mae is married and has one child. She is 24 years old and lives in San Antonio, Siquijor, Siquijor. Charo Mae has operated a motorcycle transportation business for 4 years, earning PHP 3,000 monthly. She has requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase equipment for her business. Charo Mae has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for more than one year. In the future, she hopes to improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase equipment for her transportation business

loans.name: Ratha

texts.en:
Ratha (shown in the photo), age 25, is single. She lives with her widowed mother in a village approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Ratha is a garment worker. She is asking for her first loan of $1,200 in order to buy a motorbike to get work because she does not have her own transportation.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to get work.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Nancy is providing multipurpose cab or jeepney services, with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 7,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the jeepney.

Nancy has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Nancy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the jeepney.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is 49 years old and lives in Lupagan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has 3 children. Evelyn has a business selling a variety of dried fish and earns about PHP 2,500 each month. Evelyn  has requested a loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase variety of dried fish. Evelyn has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. In the future, she would like to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of  dried fish

loans.name: Ann

texts.en: Ann, 41, is married and resides with her husband in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. Ann and her husband sell palm products. Ann is requesting a loan of US $550 to purchase cows to raise for sale. By doing so, her family will be able to generate more income. In the future, Ann would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy cows to raise for sale

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty is married and has 3 children. She is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. Betty has been a farmer for 20 years, growing rice to earn a living. She has requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase fertilizer for her rice plantation. Betty has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, she hopes to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her rice plantation

loans.name: Sokleang

texts.en:
Sokleang (in the photo) is 32 years old and her husband, Dy, is 39 years old. They live in a village across the Mekong River about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1993 and have two daughters who are in high school. 

Sokleang is a fish seller, while her husband is a farmer. She is asking for her first loan in the amount of 1,200 USD to buy a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for commuting

loans.name: Alma Fe

texts.en:
Alma Fe is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 

Alma Fe is making and peddling snacks like pan cakes and rice cakes. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 7,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients for making snacks for sale.

Alma Fe has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Alma Fe hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks for sale

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en: Marilou is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 4 children.  Marilou has a pigpen that sells grown & matured pigs. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy animal feed for the pigs.  Marilou has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Marilou hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy feed for the pigs

loans.name: Gina Group

texts.en:
Gina is 41 years old and lives in Kinangay Norte, Clarin, Mis. Occ. She is married with one child. Gina has a general store and earns approximately PHP 1,800 each month. She is asking for a loan of PHP 3,000 to purchase canned goods, softdrinks, noodles etc. to sell in her store.

Gina is a new member of PMPC. She is the leader of a four-person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has her own business.

In the future, Gina hopes to be successful in her chosen business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks for her general store

loans.name: Yart

texts.en:
Yart, 60, is married and resides with her husband. Yart and her husband operate their car to provide transportation services. 

Yart is requesting a loan to purchase a new car to operate the transportation service more efficiently. By doing so, her family is able to generate more income. 

In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to purchase a new car to operate her transportation service.

loans.name: Yaeun

texts.en:
Yaeun (in the photo) and her husband, Hong, live in a village across Mekong River about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have three children who are in school. 

Yaeun has full-time employment, while her husband is a horse cart driver, a fisherman and also a farmer. Yaeun is asking for another loan of 700 USD to assist in her husband’s farming business. He hopes to continue his farming business by buying seed, fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.use: to assist in her husband’s farming business by buying seed, fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Felipe  Group

texts.en:
Felipe is married with three children. Felipe is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Felipe is a farmer and grows rice to earn a living.  He has been doing this for ten years. He has requested a loan of PHP 3000 to purchase fertilizer for his rice plantation. 

Felipe has been a member of PMPC for two months. In the future, Felipe hopes to support children's education.

Felipe is the leader of a two person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for his rice plantation.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 6 children. 

Pedro is farming or planting organic mushrooms that are edible and selling them per kilogram. He has had this business for 10 years. He requested a loan for 7,000 PHP to buy fertilizers or humus for the organic mushrooms.

Pedro has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Pedro hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers or humus for the organic mushrooms

loans.name: Juana Marta

texts.es: Juana, de 66 años, es comerciante dueña de una pulpería, viuda, tiene hijos son  mayores de edad. Inicio su negocio hace 17 años cuando murió de su esposo pues el era el único que sostenía a la familia pero ella siguió con el negocio y junto con sus hijos salieron adelante levantaron el negocio y han sobrevivido de el , esta mas surtido que antes. Ella realizo el préstamo para surtir su pulpería con productos tales como granos básicos, pan , aceite, azúcar, snacks dulces , productos de limpieza, cosméticos y adornos. Ya que se acerca la temporada navideña y quiere aprovechar las buenas ventas que se dan en la época. Uno de sus planes es comprar 2 vitrinas que le hacen falta y un exhibidor para mostrar sus productos.
texts.en: Juana, age 66, owns a small store. She is a widow and has adult children. She started her business 17 years ago when her husband died, since he had been the sole provider for the family. She has kept the business going. She and her children have succeeded with the business and they have more stock now than ever. She is taking out this loan to stock her store with products such as basic grains, bread, oil, sugar, sweets, cleaning products, cosmetics, and decorations. Christmas is coming up, and she wants to take advantage of the good sales that are typical of this season. One of her plans is to buy two display cases and another showcase for her products.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, bread, oil, sugar, sweets, cleaning products, cosmetics, and decorations.

loans.name: Claudette

texts.en:
Claudette is married with one child. Claudette is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Claudette is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. She has requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase additional pigs to raise. 

Claudette has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Claudette hopes to save money for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional pigs to raise.

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 

Riza has a shop that sells electronic loads (prepaid phone cards) from several networks like GLOBE & SMART. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 7,000 PHP to buy stocks of electronic loads.

Riza has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Riza hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of electronic loads (prepaid phone cards)

loans.name: Or

texts.en: Or, 54, is married and resides with her husband. Or grows rice and her husband repairs motorbikes for people in his village. Or is requesting a loan of US $1,200 to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work. By doing so, her family will be able to decrease their public transportation expenses. In the future, Or would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her children to commute to work

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia is 59 years old and lives in Corrales, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has 5 children. Lydia has a business selling rice cakes and earns about PHP 5,000 each month. She has requested a loan of PHP 3,000 to buy rice. a primary ingredient of her snack vending business. Lydia has been a member of PMPC for 1 year.  In the future, she would like to have her own store in the locality.

loans.use: To purchase rice, a primary ingredient of her snack vending business.

loans.name: Christy

texts.en:
Christy is 18 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single with one child.

Christy has a shop that sells fish like sardines and mackerel. She has had this business for one year. She requested a loan for 7,000 PHP to buy fish to sell.

Christy has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Christy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Rosa Marie

texts.en: Rosa Marie is 18 years old and married. She has no children yet. Rosa Marie raises pigs to earn a living since she wants to support her husband and save for their future. She requested this loan to purchase piglets, feed and vitamins. Rosa Marie hopes for her small business to grow. She plans to make improvements to their house once her income becomes stable.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, feed and vitamins

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is from Militar, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 43 years old, married and has four children. Pacita has operated a general store in the local community for over 3 years, selling a variety of food and home use products such as candies, milo (a beverage), shampoo, soaps and many other items. Pacita earns approximately 2,920 PHP a month from her business.

Pacita is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. In 2008, Pacita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Largo Filomena Group

texts.en:
Filomena is married and has 5 children. She is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. Filomena has been a farmer for 5 years, growing corn to earn a living. She has requested a loan of PHP 12,000 to purchase fertilizer for the corn plantation. Filomena has been a member of PMPC for 5 years. In the future, she hopes to send her children to college.

Filomena is the leader of a 5-person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has her own business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for the corn plantation

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is 31 years old and is married with two children, ages 2 and 7. To earn a living, Perla raises pigs. She started her business 3 years ago and is able to help her husband in providing for their needs through her business.

Perla is asking for a loan to buy additional feed and piglets to raise. She hopes to continue supporting her family and wants to save for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and piglets to raise and sell.

loans.name: Marrieta

texts.en:
Marrieta is 52 years old and lives in Poblacion, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has five children.

To earn a living, Marrieta makes and sells snacks such as suman (rice cake wrapped in banana leaves) and pancakes. She earns about 3,000 Philippine pesos each month from her business, and plans to use the proceeds of this loan to buy ingredients to make more snacks to sell.

Marrieta has been a member of Kiva field partner PMPC for four years.  In the future, Marrieta hopes her children will be able to graduate from college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients used for making snacks

loans.name: Noel

texts.en:
Noel is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with three children. 
Noel has a party shop that sells different kinds of party supplies and also does catering and arranges parties. He has had this business for 10 years. He has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy supplies for arranging any kind of party.
Noel has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Noel hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy supplies for arranging any kind of party.

loans.name: Ma. Irene

texts.en:
Ma. Irene is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Ma. Irene has a bakeshop that makes and sells cakes and pastries. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy raw ingredients for making cakes and pastries.

Ma. Irene has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Ma. Irene hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making cakes and pastries

loans.name: Cristelyn

texts.en:
Cristelyn is 19 years old and single. She has helped her parents in managing their corn farming business for three years. Cristelyn plants corn crops on their five hectares farm land.

Cristelyn would like to borrow additional capital from lenders because her profits are not large enough to improve her five hectares of farm land. To this purpose, she is asking for a loan of PHP 27,000. This amount will be used to buy certified seeds, fertilizer, and insecticides and to pay for the labor cost of plowing the farm land. She is hoping for continued financial support to further maintain her corn production. She also prays that her crops will not be damaged by calamities so that she can obtain a higher income to pay off her loans and to support her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy certified seeds, fertilizer and insecticides and to pay for the labor cost of plowing the farm land

loans.name: Lyra

texts.en:
Lyra is 36 and lives in Quezon City, Philippines. She has four children, two in high school and two in elementary school, and is married to Renato, a contract worker.

Lyra owns a small general store. She sells canned goods, condiments, milk, sugar, and other household foodstuffs and goods.  She’s also sells mobile phone call credit, and has a hog raising business. Her store is located adjacent to her house and her regular customers are her neighbors and others in her community. She has a minimum of 1,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) is sales each day.

Lyra plans to use this 50,000 PHP loan to buy more grocery items for her store. She says that if she's able to put more items for sale on display at her store it will help to attract more customers, and more customers may mean increased sales and more profit.  She hopes this will help her to save more money for the future of her children. 

Lyra wants to be able to send all her children to school and to have them be able to finish their studies. She wants to renovate her house and to help her husband provide good life for their family.  She is active in attending the weekly fellowship* as it helps her to learn a lot from the Bible. The word of God strengthens her spiritual life. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, condiments, milk, sugar, and other household goods

loans.name: Mansueta

texts.en:
Mansueta is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children.
 
Mansueta has a shop that sells clothing and beauty products from Natasha and Avon. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy stock from Natasha and Avon.

Mansueta has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Mansueta hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock from NATASHA and AVON

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is 46 years old and lives in Punta, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with five children.   Angelita sells fish for a living, and has been doing this for 20 years.

Angelita has requested a loan of 50,000 Philippine pesos to purchase more fish to sell.  She has been a member of Kiva field partner PMPC for seven years. In the future, Angelita hopes to see her children finish their studies, and she wants to be able to expand her business by opening up several fish stalls.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Savy

texts.en:
Savy (pictured with her loom) and her husband, Dy, live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have three sons. Two of her sons have full-time employment, and the other is in school. 

Savy is a weaver, and her husband is a house builder. She is asking for loan of $400 to buy weaving materials. She will also use a part of the loan to fill in the land behind her house because there are some small ponds behind her, which she needs to fill in.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials for her weaving business and fill in the land behind her house.

loans.name: Sivet

texts.en:
Sivet (in the photo) lives in a village about 20 kilometers south of Phnom Penh. She is a widow with two children. One of her children is a garment worker still living at home, and the other is married and lives outside the family home. 

Sivet is a farmer and also cuts grass to sell for cow feed when she is free. She is requesting another loan in the amount of $300 to buy a motorbike for her granddaughter to get work.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her granddaughter to get work.

loans.name: Ryskan

texts.ru: Рыскан 58 лет, вдова, имеет одного сына. Сын живет вместе с матерью, помогает ей по хозяйству. Рыскан на протяжении 26 лет занимается животноводством, разведением  и откормом скота. Начав с суммы в 10,000 сом (KGS), Рыскан приложила все усилия для развития своего бизнеса. На сегодняшний день , в ее хозяйстве насчитывается одна корова,  два теленка, один жеребенок, кормовая база в виде 20 тележек сена, 500 снопов кукурузы  и 1,0 тонны  кукурузы, также имеется скот на осеннем пастбище. Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Рыскан обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят и овец – молодняка. Доходы от кредита Рыскан планирует направить на реконструкцию сарая, чтобы улучшить условия содержания скота.
texts.en: Ryskan is a widow and has one son.  Her son lives together with her and helps her with the business.  Ryskan has been involved in animal husbandry, breeding and fattening up livestock for 26 years.  Having started with a sum of 10,000 som (KGS), she put all of her efforts toward growing her business.  Today, her business has one cow, two calves, one foal, a feeding base of 20 carts of hay, 500 corn sheaves, and 1 ton of corn, and also has livestock at the autumn pasture.  In order to further grow her business, Ryskan requested a loan in the sum of 120,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase calves and lambs.  She plans to use the earning from this loan to rebuild a barn in order to improve conditions for keeping livestock.

loans.use: to purchase calves and lambs

loans.name: Lyda

texts.en:
Lyda (pictured), age 20, is single. She lives with her sister, brothers and parents on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.  

Lyda is a cashier. She works for a hotel in Phnom Penh. She is asking for her first loan in the amount of $500 to add to her own money to buy a motorcycle to get to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to get to work.

loans.name: Lien

texts.en:
Lien is 28 years old and lives in Cho Town. She is married with two children who are still small.

Lien has a shop where she sells computers. She has had this business for five years and now has a monthly income of about 8,000,000 Vietnam dong (VND). 

Lien joined in Kiva field partner SEDA in 2007 and has already sucessfully taken out and repaid five loans.  The last loan she took out was about the same size as this one.   She plans to use the proceeds of this loan to buy videotapes, DVDs, and CDs to sell at her store.

loans.use: to buy videotapes, DVDs, and CDs to sell

loans.name: Saynob

texts.en:
Saynob (in the photo) sells fish, that her husband catches, at a local market. Her husband Set is a fisherman. He hopes to continue his fishing business and to buy addition fishing nets because he is in the fishing season now.
