Hence Saynob is asking for a loan of $200 to buy fishing nets for her husband’s fishing business.   

The couple has been married since 1980 and has six children, three sons and three daughters. They are living in a village about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

loans.use: To buy fishing nets for her husband’s fishing business.

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es: María Isabel de cuarenta y ocho años de edad vive con sus hijos. Ella posee una librería desde hace ya varios años, donde vende productos en variedad lápices, papel, cuadernos entre otros, últimamente ha aumentado la demanda, pues las personas que visitan la librería siempre encuentran  todo lo que necesitan con productos de excelente calidad a precios realmente accesibles, además María se caracteriza por ofrecer el mejor servicio del lugar, siempre es muy amable con la clientela; ella es una mujer entregada a su trabajo siempre buscando las mejores oportunidades para triunfar, quiere aprovechar que próximamente vendrá el mes de inicio de clases y quiere surtir el negocio con productos por mayor, es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar cuadernos,lapices, papel en variedad, pegamento etc. María Isabel tiene fe que de esta forma logrará darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Maria Isabel, 48, lives with her children.  She has had a stationery store for a number of years, where she sells a variety of products including pencils, paper, notebooks, and other items.  Lately she has seen an increase in demand, as the people who visit her store always are able to find what they need, with products of excellent quality at truly affordable prices.  In addition, Maria is known for offering the best service in the area; she is always very friendly to her customers.  She is a woman who is devoted to her work and is always seeking better opportunities so that she can be successful.   Classes will be starting soon, and she wants to take advantage of this by stocking her store with more products purchased at wholesale.  For this reason she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL that will allow her to buy notebooks, pens, a variety of paper, glue, etc.  Maria Isabel has faith that in this way she will be able to provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, pens, a variety of paper and glue

loans.name: Sal

texts.en:
Sal (pictured above) is 32 years old and his wife, Tha is 31 years old. They live in a village about twenty five kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2010 and have no children yet. His wife is a garment worker. 

Sal has two lines of business: (1) purchase and sale of rice, (2) raising pigs and fish. He is asking for his first loan in the amount of $1,200 to purchase additional rice for sale and to buy fish feed.

loans.use: To purchase additional rice for sale and to buy fish feed.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 49 years old and lives in Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Efraim, a foam vendor, and is the mother of four children.  Two of her children have jobs, one is in college, and the youngest is in elementary school.

Gloria owns a small general store where she sells items such as canned food, condiments, milk, sugar, and everday household goods. Her store is adjacent to her house and her regular customers are her neighbors and others in her community. She says she has a minimum of 500 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.  Gloria plans to use this 10,000 PHP loan to buy more inventory for her store.  She wishes that her business will continue to grow.

Gloria hopes that she will be able to continue paying for her children's education and that they will able to finish their studies. She wants them to enjoy a good life.  She is active in attending the weekly fellowship* as it helps her to learn a lot from the Bible.  The word of God strengthens her spiritual life. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy items such as canned food, condiments, milk, and sugar

loans.name: Them

texts.en: Them is 40 years old and has three children who attend school. Her main business is a shop where she sells packaging. She has operated this business for 5 years and has a monthly income of about 7,000,000 VND. Them has participated in SEDA since 2007, using the loans for her business. She repaid her last loan of 8,736,000 VND punctually.  In this loan cycle, Them would like to borrow 9,632,000 VND to expand her shop and buy more packaging to sell.

loans.use: to buy more packaging to sell.

loans.name: Rom

texts.en: Rom, 35,  and her husband sell vegetables. Rom is requesting a loan of US $500 to purchase a motorbike to transport the vegetables to resell.  By doing so, her family will be able to decrease their public transportation expenses. In the future, Rom would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to transport vegetables to resell

loans.name: Cecile

texts.en:
Cecile, 49 years old, is married and has 3 children. She lives in Baclayon, Bohol with her family. Cecile sells imported products and RTW clothes to people in her community. She also sells souvenir items such as key chains. Cecile works hard to support her family. She said that she wants to be able to send her children to school, have them finish college and find jobs.

Cecile has requested this loan to purchase ladies' and men's shirts and accessories. She hopes that this loan helps her business grow.

loans.use: to purchase ladies' and men's shirts and accessories

loans.name: Charlyn

texts.en:
Charlyn is a married woman from Baclayon, Bohol. She runs a tailoring business from her home, earning 8,000 PHP each month from it. Charlyn also sells detergents to her community. She works hard to support her family and save for her child's education.

Charlyn has requested this loan to purchase clothes, thread and other materials. Charlyn hopes to have a progressive business.

loans.use: to purchase clothes, thread and other materials

loans.name: Batkhuyag

texts.en: Lately Batkhuyag's earnings have decreased notably because there are too many damages to his minivan. The number of his passengers and his income have both decreased in the last few months. Batkhuyag has a plan to renovate his minivan immediately, whereupon his service quality and customer satisfaction will improve as well. The loan he is taking will be used to purchase the spare parts for his minivan repairs.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his minivan repairs

loans.name: Ma.theresa

texts.en:
This is Theresa, 49. She is a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Rogelio, who is a teacher, and she is a mother of five children. She keeps herself busy attending to her family and business. 

Theresa purchases computers, cellphones, cameras and accessories made of silver and offers them for sale in offices, neighborhoods and the community. She has plenty of items like laptops, digital cameras and silver accessories. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and passersby in the community. She earns a minimum of 400 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more gadgets and silver accessories to sell. The more items displayed at the store, the better. She wants to have more stock of accessories with various designs. She wants to have more profit that she will save for the needs of her children. 

Theresa hopes that her business will grow and last longer. She dreams that all her children will be able to finish their studies and have a good life. She is active in attending the weekly fellowship* meetings as they help her to learn a lot from the Bible and she wants to know more about God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stock of gadgets and silver accessories needed in her business.

loans.name: Tuya

texts.en:
Tuya is 51 years old and has been working as a banker for 33 years. She is currently a teller in a commercial bank. She lives with her two sons and her husband in a boundary district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

One of Tuya’s sons will be married in January 2012 and she wants to prepare wedding gifts for him, such as a ger, which is a traditional nomadic Mongolian tent that has been used for many thousand years. For Mongolians, this is a most respectful and big gift, especially for new family. 

Tuya is requesting a loan to cover the cost of purchasing a ger for her son’s wedding gift.

loans.use: to purchase a ger as a gift for her son's wedding

loans.name: Taman Indah Group

texts.en: Ni Wayan has a plan to expand her business by buying superior piglets. Ni Wayan will use her loan to purchase four superior piglets to increase her income. With her last loan, she succeeded in breeding two pigs for fattening. The business will help her income and family needs. Ni Wayan hopes the next period will be better and that she earns more profit.

loans.use: to buy two piglets for fattening.

loans.name: Temuujin

texts.en:
Temuujin, 31, makes and sells popcorn in his own small shop, which is called “Temuujin.” He has been running this business for the past four years and has gained a good deal of experience.  Temuujin lives with his two children and his wife in the boundary district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Temuujin has permanent customers and they all feel happy about “Temuujin” popcorn.

Temuujin is requesting a loan to purchase new equipment for his popcorn shop. He needs to renovate his equipment in order to improve and expand, which will be very beneficial and important for the good future of his business.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment to make popcorn

loans.name: Ngan

texts.en:
Ngan is 47 years old and has three adult children. For the past five years, she has run a restaurant where she sells instant noodles, noodles, and breads for dinner. Ngan earns a monthly income of about 6,000,000 VND. She has participated in SEDA since 2007 and has punctually repaid her previous loan of 8,736,000 VND. 

Ngan is requesting a 9,632,000 VND loan to buy more tables, chairs, and other things for her restaurant.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, and restaurant supplies

loans.name: Nguyệt

texts.en:
Nguyêt is 42 years old and married with three children. She joined SEDA in 2007 and has found it to be very good. She is now trading and selling bicycles and earns a total monthly income of 6,000,000 VND. She has borrowed five previous loans from SEDA.

Nguyêt is requesting a 9,632,000 VND loan to buy more bicycles to sell.

loans.use: to buy bikes to sell

loans.name: Men

texts.en:
Men is 29 years old. She lives in Trung Ban village and has two children who are going to school. Men has a workshop and her husband works there producing wood furniture. Men makes tofu and earns a monthly income of about 6,000,000 VND. She has participated in SEDA since 2007 and has punctually repaid her previous loan of 7,392,000 VND.

Men is requesting a 9,632,000 VND loan to buy wood for her workshop.

loans.use: to buy wood for her workshop

loans.name: Marina

texts.ru: Марина жительница района Кумсангир. Она замужем. Ей 45 лет. У нее двое детей. Ее муж пастух, а дочь портниха. Сама Марина занимается шитьем национальных платьев. Она уже год как занимается этим видом деятельности. Кредит берет для покупки швейной машинки.
texts.en: Marina is a resident of the Qumsangir region. She is married. She is 45 years old and has two children. Her husband is a shepherd and her daughter is a dressmaker. Marina herself sews national dresses. She has been in this line of work for a year already. She is requesting a loan to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.use: purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Noor-Un-Nisa's Group

texts.en:
N.-un-Nisa has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband, who operates a vegetable-selling business. With the loan, he will buy fresh vegetables, such as potatoes and onions, in larger quantities to improve his business. He is a very hard-working person who works with full dedication. He gets up early in the morning to visit the market where he purchases vegetables at low prices and then sells them to his community clients for a profit.

N.-un-Nisa is hopeful that a loan will help him to earn more profits from his business, and she will be able to send her youngest son, who is now three years old, to school. She has two other children who are continuing their studies. N.-un-Nisa strongly desires that her children receive a good education. She started a clothes-selling business a few years ago to afford their school fees. She is confident that her husband's business will grow after the loan investment.

loans.use: to buy seasonal vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz is a widow. She lost her husband a few years ago to a sudden death, which was a great tragedy for her family. But she never lost hope. She started a decorative embroidery and sewing business to afford her children's living expenses. She is the mother of four sons and two daughters. Only her youngest daughter is studying, because her other children couldn’t complete their educations due to financial constraints.

Shahnaz has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her business. With the loan investment, she will buy unstitched clothes in bulk quantities. Then she will sew them and add beautiful embroidery in order to sell them for a higher profit. She has been operating her business for many years, and she is confident that her business will be successful after receiving her loan.

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called the Asasah Passbook) is Shahnaz.

loans.use: to buy clothes for her sewing and embroidery business.

loans.name: Ozoda

texts.ru: Озода занимается подшивкой скатерти и вязанием шерстяных шапок. Ей 49 лет. Этим видом деятельности она занимается 20 лет. Она вдова. У нее двое детей. Ее вид деятельности является семейным. Она берет кредит для приобретения ниток и тканей.
texts.en: Ozoda works in knitting tablecloths and wool caps. She is 49 years old. She has been in this line of work for 20 years. She is a widow and has two children. Her work is a family business. She is requesting a loan to purchase yarn and fabric.

loans.use: purchase yarn and fabric.

loans.name: Nurjan

texts.ru: Нуржану 37 лет,  он отец пятерых детей.  Пять лет назад, в поисках дополнительного источника дохода для своей семьи, Нуржан начал свой бизнес в разведении скота и реализации сельхозпродукции на местном рынке.  Начав со стартовой суммой в 1,000 сом (KGS), он сумел развить хозяйство, насчитывающее одну корову, 30 голов овец, 6 коз и 1 лошадь с ежемесячной прибылью около 10,000 сом. В целях дальнейшего расширения своего бизнеса, Нуржан обратился в компанию «Бай Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита он планирует направить на постройку дополнительного сарая для скота.
texts.en: Nurjan is 37 years old and the father of five children. Five years ago, in search of an additional source of income for his family. Nurjan started his own business breeding selling agricultural products in the local market. Beginning with an initial investment of 1,000 som, he managed to develop a farm of one cow, 30 sheep, 6 goats, and one horse, with a monthly income around 10,000 som. In order to grow his business, Nurjan approached Bai Tushum and Partners, requesting a loan of 60,000 som to purchase cattle. He plans to use the income from this loan to construct an additional shed for cattle

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is married and has 3 children. He is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. Daniel owns and operates farmland, planting and harvesting rice for sale to earn a living. He has been doing this for 25 years, earning PHP 16,000 every month from this work. He has requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

Daniel has been a member of GDMPC for 2 years. In the future, Daniel hopes to have his children complete their studies and to double the income from his business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 48 years old and married. She supports a family of seven members. Her spouse, Herbert, is a farmer who provides additional income for the family.  Mary's children are 20, 16, 12, 8 and 6 years old.  Mary has raised poultry in her farm in Kapsabet for 10 years, earning a monthly income of KES 8,000.

Mary has become a member of one of KADET LTD's self-help groups. She has borrowed KES 20,000 for her first term loan and wishes to use it to purchase more chickens for her farm.  Mary will use the anticipated profits to improve the farm and repay the borrowed amount. Her dream is to see her farm expand and to improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: To purchase poultry for the farm

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 49 years old and a single mother of four children. She has owned a cereals store in the Mosoriot trading centre for 10 years, earning a monthly income of KES 12,000.

Jane has recently joined KADET LTD. She has taken out her first loan of KES 30,000, which she will use to purchase five sacks of dry maize, two sacks of beans and 50 kg of rice for resale. Jane plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and save up for the family's upkeep. Jane dreams of improving her business and her family's living standards.

loans.use: To purchase cereals for resale

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 56-year-old widow with one child, aged 27. She has been a mixed crop farmer for the past 17 years, earning a monthly income of KES 60,000 which she uses to support her family.

Beatrice is applying for her fourth loan from KADET LTD, having repaid the previous loans successfully.  Beatrice will use the loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings for her farm. Beatrice plans to use the anticipated profits from the business to buy a dairy cow. Her hopes and dreams are to venture into dairy keeping which will cater for her needs.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings

loans.name: Salomat

texts.ru: Саломат жительница района Хамадони. Ей 47 лет. Она замужем. У нее пятеро детей. Двое ее сыновей уехали на заработки в Россию. Сама она имеет среднее образование. Уже два года как она занимается выращиванием овощей. Целью получения кредита является приобретение топлива для вспашки земли с помощью трактора.
texts.en: Salomat is a resident of the Hamadoni region. She is 47 years old, married with five children. Two of her sons left to work in Russia. She herself has a secondary education. For two years already she has been growing vegetables. The purpose of her loan is to procure fuel to till the land with a tractor.

loans.use: purchase fuel

loans.name: Jesca

texts.en: Jesca, 32 years old, lives in Bundibugyo,Uganda, She is married and has 3 children. Jesca owns a butcher shop, where she faces challenges such as limited capital for expansion and high fuel and transportation costs. Her personal goals are to build a good house and to educate her children. Her business goal is to expand into new markets. Jesca needs money to buy bulls for slaughtering.

loans.use: to buy bulls for slaughtering

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en: Isaac, 30 years old, lives in Bundibugyo Uganda. He is married and has 3 children. Isaac is facing many challenges in his cocoa plantation: seasonal weather, pests and diseases, theft, and inadequate capital to expand his plantation. His personal objectives are to educate his children and have a good looking house for his family. Isaac needs money in order to harvest his cocoa and buy seedlings.

loans.use: to harvest his cocoa  and buy seedlings

loans.name: Jacinta Kagwiria

texts.en: Jacinta is married and has 3 children whose ages range from 1 to 6 years old. She describes herself as honest and ambitious. Jacinta has operated a farm for 10 years, selling vegetables. Her business is located in a shopping center. Jacinta's biggest business challenge is the increased cost of farm seeds. She will use this KES 20,000 loan to buy farm seeds. Her business goal is to cultivate the other parts of her land in order to increase her vegetable production within 5 years.

loans.use: To buy farming seeds.

loans.name: John Thuku

texts.en: John is married and has three daughters whose ages range from 5 to 11 years old. John has operated a general store for the last three years. His business is faced with the problem of inadequate funds to increase its stock. John will use this KES 15,000 loan to buy maize and wheat flours and other items. Within the next five years, John wants to run a supermarket and be a wholesaler.

loans.use: To buy maize and wheat flours

loans.name: Mwamwathi

texts.en: Mwamwathi is married and has seven children whose ages range from 20 to 30 years old. She describes herself as ambitious. Mwamwathi has operated a grocery store for the last ten years. The business is faced with the problem of the increased price of goods. Mwamwathi will be using this KES 20,000 loan to add to the grocery store stock. She looks forward to expanding the business in the next five years.

loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Halima's Group

texts.en:
Halima is 46 years old and sells clothes to financially support her husband. She purchases clothes from a wholesale market and then sells them to her local clients for a profit. She knows fashion trends very well and offers her customers quality clothes at low prices.

Her husband is a mason who constructs buildings and houses on order. Halima is the mother of two sons. Her elder son is also a mason while her youngest son is only three years of age. She is a great mother and takes care of her children very well.

Halima is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her clothes-selling business. With the loan investment, she will purchase winter clothes in bulk quantities to offer more variety to her clients and increase her sales. She has been operating her business for many years, and she is very confident about the continued success of her business as a result of the loan investment.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is married and has six children whose ages range from 30 to 46 years old. She describes herself as ambitious. Grace has operated a grocery store for the last fifteen years. The business is faced with the problem of increased prices of goods. Grace will be using this KES 20,000 loan to add stock to her grocery store. She wants to expand the business in the future.

loans.use: To buy more stock.

loans.name: William

texts.en: William, 51 years old, is married and has 3 children. He lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. William purchases and resells cocoa. His business faces some challenges such as limited capital and price fluctuations. William wants his family to have a good permanent house. He needs money to purchase cocoa for resale.

loans.use: to purchase cocoa for resale.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine, 27 years old, is married and has no children. She has been selling clothing for 7 years. Christine is faced with the challenge of thieves stealing her stock. Her business goal is to have an established textile shop and her personal goal is to have a sustainable family with educated children. Christine needs a loan to buy clothing to sell during the festive season.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell during the festive season

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en: Bernard, 37 years old, is married and has 4 children. He has been buying and selling maize for 3 years. Bernard is faced with the challenges of price fluctuations and inflation. His business goal is to expand and increase his profits. His personal goal is to educate his children. Bernard needs a loan to buy maize for resale.

loans.use: to buy maize for resale

loans.name: Dy's Group

texts.en:
Dy, aged 50, is widowed and lives in a rural area of Thmor Koul district. She has four children: three of them are married and one is a construction worker. Dy has had a grocery business in her front yard for 6 years in order to earn a living and feed her children. She sells seasonings, biscuits, rice wine, detergent, etc. 

Dy leads a group with two female members. Both members of her group have been with VisionFund for 3 cycles. Dy has completely repaid her last loan with VisionFund, which helped her to have regular income. She now earns around $4 US per day. Dy is requesting another loan which she will use to buy grocery stock for her store. With this loan, she hopes to earn more income to build on some savings for a bigger house in the future.

loans.use: to buy groceries

loans.name: Justine

texts.en: Justine, 45 years old, is married and has 6 children. She has been buying and selling clothes for 4 years. Justine faces the challenges of high prices and rent. Her business goal is to expand her textile shop and realize more profits. Her personal goals are to educate her children, build them good houses and buy more land. Justine needs a loan to buy new clothes to resell.

loans.use: to buy new clothes to resell.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary, 32 years old, is married and has four children. She has operated a wholesale business dealing in soda, sugar and soap for 2 years. Rosemary is faced with the challenge of inflation, which affects her purchasing power. Her business goal is to open up another outlet and her personal goal is to have well-educated children. Rosemary wants a loan to purchase soda, sugar and soap to sell.

loans.use: to purchase soda, sugar and soap

loans.name: Japhet

texts.en: Japhet is a married man with a three-year-old son. He describes himself as ambitious, aggressive, humble, and loyal. He operates a pharmacy where he sells drugs for human and veterinary medicine. He has been working in this business for three years. His business is located in a shopping centre. He describes his biggest business challenge as the increased price of medicine. He will use this loan of KES 20,000 to buy more medicines. His business goal is to run more pharmacies in neighbouring shopping centres within five years.

loans.use: to increase his stock of medicine.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is from Santo Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 55 years old. Erlinda is married and has two adult children. 

Erlinda owns and operates a business selling personal products such as lotions and perfumes in the local community. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately PHP 3,000 a month for these activities.

Erlinda is requesting a loan of PHP 6,000, which will be used to buy additional products such as lipstick and makeup to sell. In 2008, Erlinda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as lipstick and make-up to sell.

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Dickson

texts.en: Dickson is a 28-year-old married man with two children living in Kasese, Uganda. His family goal is to buy a motorcycle. He has a retail business, which he has been running for two years. The main hardship is  insufficient power supply, and his dream is to expand his business into new markets. Dickson needs a loan to buy soft drinks, sugar and salt for his business.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, sugar and salt for resale.

loans.name: Naire

texts.en: Naire is engaged in agriculture. Due to her hard work and patience, Naire has created favorable conditions to develop her business, but to do so she needs sufficient financial capital. With the requested loan, Naire plans to purchase livestock, which will allow her to expand her farm and increase her income. This will help Naire to increase her family's present standard of living and ensure a sustainable future for her son, who plans to get married. Naire lives with her husband and son.

loans.use: to pay for livestock.

loans.name: Inviolata

texts.en:
Inviolata is 40 years old and married. She has five children ranging from five to twenty years old. She is a visionary woman. 

Inviolata has been a tailor for the last five years. Her business faces the problem of low purchasing power from the clients. She will be using this loan of KES 60,000 to buy materials for making clothes. In the future, Inviolata wants to be a wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy materials to making clothes.

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en: Gayane works at the local school as a teacher. Unfortunately a teacher's salary is too low to sustain her four children, thus Gayane is also engaged in agriculture. She has been successfully managing the business for many years and has expanded it. Before the winter Gayane has a problem feeding her cattle. So she has applied for a loan to purchase forage. With the help of this loan Gayane will take care of the cattle properly, which will allow her to maintain her current number of the cattle. Gayane will keep getting enough income and will sustain her children.

loans.use: to buy feed for her cattle.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is from Militar, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 51 years old. Teresita is married and has two children. 

To make a living, Teresita runs a general store, selling a variety of food and home use products in the local community such as candies, cigarettes, shampoo, soap and many other things. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately PHP 3,600 a month for these activities.

Teresita is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000, which will be used to buy additional products to sell. In 2008, Teresita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy additional products to sell.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is 60 years old and married. She has owned rental houses for the last 20 years, and earns an income of KES 50,000 each month.

This is loan, from KADET LTD., is her first loan. She will use the entire loan to renovate her rental houses.

With the anticipated profits, she will purchase a plot and build more houses. She hopes to be financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to renovate her rental houses.

loans.name: Juanito

texts.en:
Juanito is a responsible father whose priority is to improve his family's living condition and let his children finish their studies. He is 34 years old, married and has three studying children.

Juanito has been running his rice fields for fourteen years and he only earnt PHP 20,000 last crop season.  He used his generated income for his family's daily needs, his children's allowances and feed for his raised hogs.  He realized that his farming business requires greater capital input for him to maintain a good harvest.  In this regard, Juanito is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan, which will serve as his additional working capital at his farm.  He will be using this loan to purchase seedlings, fertilizer and insecticides to improve his rice crops and farmland.

Jaunito hopes to make his business more profitable despite the hardships and difficulties he encounters in maintaining his agricultural business.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings, fertilizer and insecticides to improve his farmland.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan, a 42-year-old married woman with four children, lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She owns a hotel business in Bundibugyo town. Her challenges are few customers and high prices for food in the market. Her personal goal is to have a very good-looking house for the family and to educate her children in order for them to have a better life in the future. Susan wants money to purchase saucepans, plates and rice.

loans.use: to purchase sauce pans, plates and rice for the restuarant.

loans.name: Yat's Group

texts.en:
Yat, 46, is married and has three children, who are still in school. She runs a grocery store in front of her house. She sells biscuits, detergent, seasoning, etc. She also sells medicine in her grocery store. Her husband sometimes works for others to raise additional income. Now she earns less than 8 US dollars per day to feed her family.

Yat leads a group of two female members. This is the first loan for her group. She is now requesting for a loan with VisionFund. She wants to buy grocery stock and some medicines for her store. 

This loan will enable her to increase her stock of groceries and she hopes to earn more income to better feed her family and also keep her three children in school.

loans.use: to buy groceries for her store.

loans.name: Darilla

texts.en: Darilla is 26 years old and married. She has a one-year-old son. She describes herself as a focused woman. Darilla has been running a salon in Nairobi west for the last two years. Her business is faced with the problem of inadequate funds to buy cosmetic products. She will be using this loan of KES 20,000 to add to her stock of cosmetics. In the future, Darilla wants to runs a beauty college.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 23-year-old married man and the father of one child. He has been selling fruits and vegetables since 2007. Ahmad is a hard-working man. He is recommended by most of his clients because of his number-one quality products.

Ahmad is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to increase his stock of merchandise with new autumn and winter fruits and vegetables. These products will attract new customers in addition to his present ones. He is also working hard on the legal steps required to own land in the village, so that he can start planting special fruits and vegetables.

Ahmad used to have an Internet cafe, but the population where he lives aren't attracted or used to such technology. That's why he prefers  to provide them with things they need and request daily. Ahmad hopes to build his dream house and provide his family with the best education ever.

loans.use: to increase his stock of merchandise with new autumn and winter fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en: Fred is a 34-year-old married man with 2 children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He owns a retail shop in town. Fred faces some challenges in his daily running of the business, such as limited capital, price fluctuations in the market and persistent inflation in the country. His goal is to educate his children and construct a good house for his family. Fred needs money to purchase some items such as sugar, salt, soap and rice to sell.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, salt, soap and rice

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
This is Jonathan, 41. He is a resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Evelyn, a factory worker and mother to their two children – both are already in grade school. Jonathan, together with his wife and children, manages the household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses and support his children’s schooling -- a dream for most poor Filipino parents who, like Jonathan, believe that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.

Jonathan operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a 5-pesos worth of cooking oil or an egg. Jonathan earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Aside from this, he also sells coconuts. His store is located adjacent to his house. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 800 Philippines pesos (Php) in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a Php 8,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand his product inventory. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business.

Jonathan hopes to be able to expand soon and upgrade his business to a mini grocery, just as he fervently hopes that his children will be able to graduate one day, and finish their studies. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week, and this is where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in his business.

loans.name: Armen

texts.en: Armen produces and trades in furniture.  Armen has been in this business for the past four years, through which he has managed to gain a large number of cilents from different parts of the city.  Due to the quality of his work Armen receives many orders and now he can't get enough boards to make the furniture.  This loan will help Armen to purchase the necessary boards and build the ordered furniture.  Armen will increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.  Armen lives together with his wife and mother.

loans.use: to pay for boards to make furniture.

loans.name: Amanda Magdalena

texts.es: Amanda Magdalena D. 37 años D. edad, habita en casa propia junto con su grupo familiar el cual está conformado por su esposo y su querida hija D. 7 años D. edad la cual se encuentra cursando sus primeros años D. estudio. Amanda se dedica al comercio.  Con grades esfuerzos ha logrado mantener activa una pequeña tiendita en la cual venD. variedad D. productos D. belleza tanto para hombre como para mujer. Ella  se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, carismática y sobre todo emprendedora. Amanda tiene muchas ideas D. negocio las cuales poco a poco va poniendo en marcha. Una D. esas ideas es su tienda me productos D. belleza la cual gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado sacar adelante  y con la ayuda D. Dios los esfuerzos realizados no han sido en vano. Su sueño es seguir manteniendo activo su negocio por mucho tiempo por lo que siempre trata D. mantenerse un paso adelante D. la competencia y es así como ha sabido ganarse la confianza D. sus vecinos los cuales manifiestan estar satisfechos con el servicio prestado por Amanda.  Ha tomado la decisión D. solicitar este préstamo  a INTEGRAL para invertir en su pequeño negocio en la comprar D. productos D. belleza tales como: Perfumería, cremas, cosméticos, etc. Tanto para hombre como para mujer. D. esta manera espera mejorar el servicio a los clientes con el objetivo D. mejorar su nivel D. ventas como D. ingresos D. tal forma que poco a poco pueda ir mejorando su calidad D. vida como la D. su familia. Amanda mantiene un profundo agradecimiento con INTEGRAL ya que en el pasado ha recibido préstamo y es así como ha logrado salir adelante ya que se le brindo ayuda y se confió en su capacidad D. pago.
texts.en: Amanda Magdalena, age 37, lives in her own house together with her husband and her beloved daughter, who is 7 years old - the age at which one begins one's first years of formal schooling. Amanda is a businesswoman. With great effort she has succeeded in keeping her small shop going, selling a range of beauty products for men and women. She describes herself as a woman who is hard-working, charismatic, and above all enterprising. Amanda has lots of business ideas, which she is setting in motion one by one. Her beauty products store is one such idea, which she has been able to set up through her own determination - and with God's help, her efforts were not in vain. Her dream is to keep her business going for a long time. She always tries to remain a step ahead of the competition and has earned the support of her neighbours, who are happy with the service Amanda provides. She has taken the decision to seek this loan from INTEGRAL to invest in her little business by buying beauty products such as perfumes, creams, and cosmetics, including products for men as well as women. In this way she expects to improve the service she offers her customers, with the aim of improving her sales - and her income so that she can continue improving her family's standard of living. Amanda is profoundly grateful to INTEGRAL becuase she has had a loan from them in the past, which allowed her to succeed in her venture so far, because they have offered her support once again and shown confidence in her ability to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, etc

loans.name: Grace Bosibori

texts.en: Grace Bosibori is 25 years old and single. She describes herself as aggressive. She has run a salon in the town of Nakuru for the last two years. Her business is faced with the problem of inadequate funds to buy hair oil and shampoo. She will be using the loan of 10,000 Kenyan shillings to buy shampoo, weaves, lotions and relaxers.

loans.use: To buy shampoo, weaves, relaxers and lotions.

loans.name: Venerandah

texts.en:
Venerandah is a 26-year-old married woman living in Fort Portal, Uganda.  She owns a retail shop where she sells general merchandise. She used to only grow cabbages and after a good harvest she sold them off and started a retail shop.  

She faces the challenge of price fluctuations and inflation, customers not paying on time and the seasonal weather.  

Her dreams are educating her children, building a permanent home and buying a car. Venerandah needs the loan to grow cabbages and to buy soap, sugar and rice to sell.

loans.use: to grow cabbages and to buy soap, sugar and rice to sell.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 52 years old, married to Nancy and they have three school-going children. He has been in farming for the last 21 years with an income of KES.80,000 a month.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend and this is his third loan from KADET LTD. He will use the entire loan to buy seeds and pesticides.

With the anticipated profits, he will purchase a plot and build rental houses. He hopes to be able to grow his business and be a great farmer and invest more in real estate in the future

loans.use: To buy seeds and pesticides

loans.name: Urozali

texts.ru: Урозали берет кредит для закупа несколько голов бычка и телят. Он хочет увеличить количество скота.
texts.en: Urozali is requesting a loan to purchase a few bulls and calves. He wants to increase the number of cattle.

loans.use: purchase a few bulls and calves.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a 26-year old married man with two children living in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda.
He rides a motorcycle and earns income with it. He has been in this business for six years and is challenged by the high fuel prices and the bad weather. He started by riding other peoples' motorcycles and later saved money and bought his own motorcycle. His business dream is to own more motorcycles. Stephen needs the loan to buy a new motorcycle for transportation.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle for transportation

loans.name: Kibisi W.g. Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth is the facilitator of the Kibisi W.G. group. Elizabeth and her group joined Kiva partner One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
Elizabeth joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, she had an excellent maize yield harvesting twenty-two bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Elizabeth was only able to harvest eight bags of maize on one acre of land.
With income from maize sales, Elizabeth will educate her children and build a house. With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Elizabeth and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit, and insurance.
In 2012, the members of Kibisi W.G. group will each plant maize plots between half and one acre of land.
The photograph shows Elizabeth with her group members. The field officer is standing on the far left.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Tigran

texts.en: Tigran is engaged in an agricultural business. He keeps livestock and cultivates land. Tigran lives together with his wife, parents and brother, who help him with daily agricultural activities. Tigran plans to purchase livestock, forage (bulky food such as grass or hay) for the cattle, and seeds to cultivate the land. This requires some financial investments. With the help of this loan, Tigran will expand his farm and successfully cultivate his land. This will allow Tigran to get enough income to sustain his family and ensure better future for them.

loans.use: to purchase livestock, forage, and seeds

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen, 48 years old, is married and has four children ranging from 11 to 22 years old. He describes himself as optimistic. He runs a retail store where he renders the service of repairing televisions and radios. The business is faced with the problem of inadequate funds to maintain it. He will be using the loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to expand his repair store.

loans.use: To extend the store for electronics repair.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay for more snacks, salted fish, and detergent to sell from her general store.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en: Alex used the previous loan to buy sugar, salt, and soap for sale and has progressed amidst price fluctuations and inflation, customers not paying on time, and inadequate capital to purchase merchandise. His business goals are expanding his business into new markets and moving his business to a more permanent location. Alex needs the loan to buy powdered soap, millet flour, and sugar for sale ahead of this Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy powdered soap, millet flour, and sugar for sale.

loans.name: José Rubselin

texts.es: José Rubselin de 27 años de edad, habita en casa familiar junto con su compañera de vida y su pequeño hijo.  José posee un pequeño comedor en el cual ofrece diversidad de ricos platillos. Él se caracteriza por ser un hombre trabajado, responsable y muy dedicado en sus responsabilidades. Posee muy buenas referencias de los vecinos ya que con el tiempo ha sabido ganarse la confianza y ya es muy conocido en la zona. Su sueño es poder dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y es por esta razón que ha decidido solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su negocio con el fin de mejorar el servicio prestado de tal manera que cada día  los clientes se sientan más identificados  y lo prefieran más. Con el crédito piensa comprar los insumos necesarios (verduras, carnes, aceite, huevos, gas propano, etc.), para dar un mejor servicio a los clientes y poder cubrir una mayor demanda.  No pierde las esperanzas que de esta manera logrará su objetivo y podrá dar a su familia una mejor oportunidad de vida.
texts.en:
José Rubselin is 27 years old and lives in the family home with his life companion and their young son. He manages a small diner where he offers a variety of rich dishes. José is known for being a hardworking and responsible man who is dedicated to meeting his obligations. He has good references from his neighbors who have gotten to trust him over time. José is well-known in the area. His dream is to provide a better quality of life for his family. For this reason, he decided to request a loan from Apoyo Integral so that he can invest in his business.

By improving the services he provides to his customers each day, they in return will identify more with his establishment and prefer to do business with him. With this loan, José plans to buy necessary supplies such as vegetables, meats, oil, eggs, propane gas, and other items so that he can provide better service to his customers and be able to meet the higher demand. José does not lose hope that he will achieve his goal and be able to provide his family a better opportunity in life.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meats, oil, eggs, propane gas, and other supplies.

loans.name: Emie

texts.en:
Emie is from Militar, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 34 years old. Emie is married and has four children. 

To make a living, Emie owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community such as candies, cigarettes, shampoo, soaps and many others. Emie has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 9,280 PHP a month for these activities. 

Emie is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. In 2009, Emie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve/expand the business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Va

texts.en: Mrs. Va, 61, is a humble farmer who has been living in Baray district, Cambodia. She is a widow and lives with two single children, while the other 3 children are married and live independently. She grows rice crops for her livelihood, earning an average of $4.00 per day. One of her daughters is working as a seamstress in her village and presently she needs some more capital to sustain her business. Therefore, Mrs. Va decided to ask for some funds from HKL and Kiva to purchase an additional sewing machine and many pieces of cloths (fabric) that could be used to make finished clothes for customers. This loan will improve her daughter’s business. In the future, Mrs. Va hopes to send her two children to attend university.

loans.use: to purchase an additional sewing machine and many pieces of cloths (fabric)

loans.name: Edison

texts.en: Edison is a 48-year-old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His current business is a retail shop which he started by selling his cows and mobilizing the money to start this business. The hardships he faces are price fluctuations and inflation, customers not paying on time, and inadequate capital to buy merchandise. His personal goals are educating his children and buying another piece of land. Edison needs the loan to buy salt, maize flour, and match boxes for sale.

loans.use: to buy salt, maize flour, and match boxes for sell.

loans.name: Karine

texts.en: Karine is engaged in agriculture. She cultivates potatos, corn, beens and keeps cattle. Karine lives together with her husband, who helps her with the business. Karine plans to increase the number of cattle and expand her farm. With the requested loan Karine plans to purchase calves and sheep. This loan will help Karine to make her dream come true and establish a big farm in the future. This will play an important role in the community's agricultural development.

loans.use: to purchase calves and sheep

loans.name: Minh

texts.en: Minh is 37 years old. She has three children who are going to school. She has a store. She sells cobbler. She has had this job for three years. She has a monthly income of about 6.000.000 Vietnamdong (VND). She has participated in SEDA since 2007. The last time, she borrowed 7.840.000 VND and has since repaid the loan punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9.632.000 VND to buy food items, drinks, dairy product and other things for her store.

loans.use: to buy food items, drinks, dairy product, and other things for her store.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is married and they have five children. She has been running a tailoring shop for the last five years. Her business is faced with the challenges of competition within the area and low purchasing power. She will use the loan of Kes 20,000 to buy materials for making school uniforms and dresses as she anticipates that customers will buy more clothes with the upcoming December holiday. In the future, Margaret wants to run a tailoring training school.

loans.use: To buy materials for making clothes.

loans.name: José William

texts.es: José William de 33 años  de edad, habita en casa familiar junto con su grupo familiar el cual está conformado por su compañera de vida y sus dos hijas las cuales se encuentran cursando sus primeros años de estudio.  José se dedica a la venta de gas propano. Tiene muchos años de dedicarse a esta actividad y gracias a Dios y a su esfuerzo los resultados han sido satisfactorios. Para él lo más importante es su familia y es por ella que lucha día a día para poder darles lo que se merecen. Además no pierde las esperanzas de ver a sus hijas convertidas en grandes profesionales. José se caracteriza por ser luchador, responsable y dedicado en su trabajo. Ha estado pensando mucho la posibilidad de mejorar su negocio es decir invertir más con el fin de abarcar una mayor demanda. Esto lo ha llevado a solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su pequeño negocio en la compra de gas propano al por mayor ya que se acerca la temporada navideña y tiene la confianza de que en esta época las ventas mejoraran por lo que quiere estar preparado.  No pierde la esperanza que de esta manera logrará mejora su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
José William, age 33, lives in his family home with his partner and their two daughters, who are in their first years of primary school. José selss propane gas. He has been doing this for many years - and thanks to God, as well as the effort he has put in, business has been very satisfactory. 

The most important thing in José's life is his family, and it is for them that he strives day by day, to give them everything they deserve. He has a hope that he might see his daughters grow up to be educated professional people. José describes himself as being determined, responsible, and dedicated to his work. He has been thinking that he could improve his business by investing more with the aim of expanding into a bigger market. This decision has brought him to seek a loan with INTEGRAL to invest in his small business buy buying more propane in wholesale quantities. Christmas time is coming and he is confident that sales will increase around this time, so he wants to be well prepared. He hopes that by expanding in this way he will succeed in improving his family's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy propane gas at wholesale

loans.name: Sok's Group

texts.en:
Sok is a 25-year-old mother of five children, who all are dependents. Her two oldest children are still in school while the other three are not of school age yet. She is a farmer in a rural area of the Thmor Koul district where the typical business is rice farming. She has been farming since she was with her parents when she was about 10 years old. Her husband catches fish for sale. Nowadays, she earns around 10 US dollars to feed her big family. 

Sok leads a group of two female members. She and her group member have been with VisionFund for 4 cycles and completely repaid the last loan with VisionFund. Now she is requesting for another loan to buy rice seeds to grow on her five-hectare farmland she leases from a villager.

She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her rice plantation and make more rice to earn more income to better feed her family and keep all her children in school.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds for her rice plantation

loans.name: Hellen Kinya

texts.en: Hellen Kinya, age 46, is married and has five children ranging from 14 to 27 years. She has run a grocery store in the last 15 years. The business is faced with the problem of increased cost of goods. She will be using the loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to add stock to the grocery store. In the future, Hellen wants to expand her business.

loans.use: To add stock to the grocery store.

loans.name: Seda

texts.en: Seda is engaged in an agricultural business. She has been successfully managing the business for thirteen years and has created a sustainable basis to enlarge it. With the requested loan, Seda plans to purchase a cow and a calf. Increase of the livestock will allow Seda to get more income and improve her family's living conditions. Seda lives together with her husband and one child.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and a calf

loans.name: Khun

texts.en: Khun, 38, is married and resides with her husband in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkorean temples. Khun and her husband sell vegetables. Khun is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase a motorbike to transport vegetables to resell. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to transport vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Siddiqan's Group

texts.en:
Siddiqan is married and has no children. She is 53 years old and operates a grocery store from her home to financially support her husband, who works for the city's Municipal Corporation. At her shop, Siddiqan sells everyday household items such as spices, salt, soaps, cooking oil, and sugar at low prices. Her clients are very satisfied with her good-quality products and service. Along with running her business, she also performs her household duties very well. 

Siddiqan is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her business. With the loan investment, she will purchase grocery products in bulk quantities, which will allow her to fulfill the needs of her community clients and increase her sales and profits. She is very new to her business, having started it last year. She is confident that a loan will help her become established in her business.

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called the Asasah Passbook) is Siddiqan.

loans.use: to buy products for her grocery business.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en: Mom, 35, is married and resides with her husband in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkorean temples. Mom produces traditional cakes to sell, and her husband is a construction worker. Mom is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase two water buffaloes to help plow the rice fields. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy two water buffaloes .

loans.name: Alvard

texts.en: Alvard keeps livestock and cultivates land. She lives together with her husband, who is also engaged in daily agricultural activities. In preparation for the upcoming winter season Alvard plans to purchase necessary forage for the livestock. Thus she has applied for a loan. With the loan's help, Alvard will sustain the livestock with forage during the long winter season. This will allow her to maintain the current number of livestock and create appropriate conditions for further development of the farm.

loans.use: to pay for forage for her livestock.

loans.name: María Mercedes

texts.es: María Mercedes D. 47 años D. edad, habita en casa propia junto con su grupo familiar el cual está conformado por su esposo, hija y su nieta. Ella se dedica al comercio, tiene muchos años D. dedicarse a esta actividad por lo que ya cuenta con mucha experiencia.  María se caracteriza por ser una mujer emprendedora ya que tiene muchas ideas D. negocio  y poco a poco va poniendo en  marcha. Con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado establecer un pequeño  puesto en su hogar D. residencia en el cual venD. variedad D. prendas D. vestir para todos los gustos, y preferencia. Su sueño es mantener su negocio surtido con variedad D. prendas D. vestir con el objetivo D. atraer a más clientes que le permitan mejorar su calidad D. vida y la D. su familia. Es por esta razón que ha decidido solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su negocio en la compra D. prendas D. vestir ( faldas, pantalones, camisas, blusas, ropa interior, etc.), con el fin D. mejorar la calidad D. vida que por el momento tienen. Confía en Dios que los resultados van hacer favorables.
texts.en: María Mercedes, age 47, lives in her own home with her family, which consists of her husband, daughter, and granddaughter. She dedicates her time to her sales, and having done so for many years, she has built up a lot of experience. María describes herself as being an enterprising woman, with lots of business ideas which she is gradually putting into action. With great effort and dedication, she has succeeded in establishing a small store in her home, where she sells a variety of clothing to cater to all tastes and preferences. Her dream is to keep her business stocked with a wiD. range of clothes, with the aim of attracting more customers and ultimately improving her family's standard of living. For this reason she has decided to seek a loan with INTEGRAL to invest in her business by buying items of clothing (skirts, trousers, shirts, blouses, underwear, etc). She trusts in God that the result of the investment will be to improve the standard of living she has at present.

loans.use: To buy skirts, trousers, shirts, blouses, underwear, etc

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.en:
Benedicta is from Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 57 years old. Benedicta is married and has one adult child. 

To make a living, Benedicta sells a variety of fruits and vegetables in the local community. Benedicta has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

Benedicta is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell. In 2010, Benedicta joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Tete W.g. Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Tete W.G. Group in Western Kenya! This group joined Kiva partner One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
Ann is the facilitator of the Tete W.G. Group. She takes care of six children at home. She joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund's best prices and to grow enough to feed the family. In the recent 2011 season, Ann had a very good maize yield harvesting nine bags on half an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Ann was only able to harvest three bags of maize on half an acre of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Ann and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit, and insurance.
With income from maize sales, Ann will educate her children. In 2012, the members of Tete W.G. Group will each plant between half and one acre of maize.
In the photograph, Ann is pictured with her group members. The person standing on the far left is the field officer.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Sokun

texts.en: Sokun, 43, is married and resides with her husband in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkorean temples.  She is a chef, and her husband is a motor-taxi driver. Sokun is requesting a loan of USD $800 to purchase a new motorbike to help her husband operate his business more efficiently. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner. Sokun appears in the photograph with her husband and daughter.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike to operate the business more efficiently

loans.name: José Baltazar

texts.es: José Baltazar  de 37 años de edad, habita en casa familiar junto con su querida hija de 14 años la cual se encuentra estudiando. José se dedica a la confección y venta de ropa deportiva.  Tiene muchos años de dedicarse al negocio por lo que ya cuenta con mucha experiencia.  Para José su hija lo es todo y es por ella que día a día se levanta muy temprano para trabajar y tener listo los pedidos los cuales son muy frecuentes y necesitan ser atendidos con rapidez. Es muy conocido en la zona ya que es un hombre trabajador, responsable y muy delicado en su trabajo. Siempre le gusta mantener satisfechos a los clientes. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su negocio en la compra de telas, hilos, elásticos, etc. de tal manera que pueda cubrir una mayor demanda que le permita mejorar su nivel de ventas y de ingresos. Además confía en Dios que los resultados serán favorables y logrará el objetivo de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: José Baltazar, age 37, lives in his family home with his beloved 14 year old daughter, who is studying. José makes and sells sportswear. He has been in this business for many years and thus has a great deal of experience. For José, his daughter means everything to him, so it is for her that he gets up early each morning and goes out to work. He keeps a list of his orders which are most frequent, and those that need filled most urgently. He is well known locally as a hard-working, responsible man who is dedicated to his work. He always likes to keep his customers happy. He has taken the decision to seek a loan with INTEGRAL to invest in his business by buying fabric, thread, elastic, etc. In this way he will be able to expand, increase his sales and his income. He trusts in God that the investment will result in an improvement in quality of life for him and his family.

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread, elastic, etc.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is married with 2 children. She is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is a farmer who raises and sells pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for 12 years. She has requested a loan of 18,000 KES to buy piglets for her business. 

Arlene has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, she hopes to have her own meat shop.

loans.use: To buy piglets for her hog raising business.

loans.name: Yort's Group

texts.en:
Yort, aged 31, is married with three children, who are too young to attend school. He is a farmer in a rural area of Thmor Koul district, where the typical business is rice farming. He has been farming on his 2-hectare farmland for 10 years and since the age of 11 years with his parents. He earns less than $8 per day to feed his family. 

Yort leads a group of two male members. He has just joined VisionFund while his fellow group member has been with VisionFund for two years. He is now requesting a loan to buy rice seeds for his rice plantation. 

He hopes that this loan will enable him to make more rice and earn more income to set aside some money for future needs and to send his children to school.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds for his farmland.

loans.name: Euy

texts.en: Euy, 27, is married and resides with her husband in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkorean temples. She is farmer, and her husband is a blacksmith. Euy is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase cows to raise and sell. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to purchase cows to raise and sell

loans.name: Artur

texts.en: Artur is a young entrepreneur from Meghry. He runs a little cafe. In just a few years Artur has managed to gain a large number of clients due to the quality of his services.  Now Artur would like to renovate the cafe to provide services of a higher quality. With the requested loan Artur plans to purchase a freezer, furniture and floor tiles. This loan will help Artur to develop his business and increase his income. With this additional income Artur will ensure a brighter future for his family. Artur lives together with his wife and two daughters.

loans.use: to pay for a freezer, furniture and floor tiles.

loans.name: Dora Alicia

texts.es: Dora Alicia de 46 años de edad, habita en casa propia con su esposo y dos hijos. Dora  es una mujer emprendedora y luchadora. Hace algunos años se decidió en poner un pequeño negocio en su hogar de habitación. El negocio consiste en una pequeña tienda que con gran esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado mantener a lo largo de varios años. Cuenta con mucha clientela ya que para Dora lo más importante son los clientes, siempre los atiende con una sonrisa y mucha amabilidad razón por la cual se ha ganado la confianza de muchos en la zona y a demás porque siempre tiene lo que los clientes buscan. Dora sueña con dar a sus hijos  una mejor calidad de vida y sabe que la única fuente de ingresos es su pequeño negocio, por tanto no puede descuidarse de  el y lucha por mantenerlo activo. Es por esta razón que se motivo en solicitar este crédito a INTEGRLAL para poder invertir en su tienda y abastecerla con todo tipo de productos como: frijoles, azúcar, arroz, leche, golosinas, aceite, papel, detergente, y de más productos que permitan a traer a mas clientes. Con  la fe puesta en Dios que de esta manera logrará cumplir su sueño.
texts.en:
Dora Alicia, who is 46, lives in her own house with her husband and two daughters. Dora is an enterprising, determined woman. Several years ago, she decided to open a small shop in her home. The business is a grocery store which, with great effort and dedication, she has succeeded in building up over several years. She has a good customer base, because the customers are the most important thing to Dora, and she always serves them with a friendly smile. This is how she has gained the confidence of people locally and the reason that people seek out her shop.

Dora dreams of giving her children a better quality of life and, as she knows that her only source of income is what she can make from the little shop, she is determined to keep it going. This is why she is seeking a loan with INTEGRAL to invest in stocking the shop with all kinds of products, such as beans, sugar, rice, milk, candies, cooking oil, paper, detergent, and other goods so that she can serve more customers. She puts her faith in God that this will help her to achieve her dream.

loans.use: To buy beans, sugar, rice, milk, candies, cooking oil, paper and detergent.

loans.name: Mawa Shg Group

texts.en:
Jackson is the facilitator of the Mawa SHG group. Jackson and his group joined Kiva partner One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
Jackson takes care of seven children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for his family and later educate his children. In the recent 2011 season, Jackson had a good maize yield harvesting seven and a half bags on half an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Jackson was only able to harvest two and a half bags of maize on half an acre of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Jackson and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit, and insurance.
With income from maize sales, Jackson will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing. In 2012, the members of Mawa SHG group will each plant maize plots between half and one acre of land.
In the photograph above, Jackson is pictured with his group members. The person standing on the far left is the field officer.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Sambo

texts.en: Sambo, 34, is married and resides with her husband in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkorean temples.  She sells traditional baskets, and her husband is a construction worker. Sambo is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase more baskets to resell. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more baskets to resell

loans.name: Peng

texts.en: Mrs. Peng is a 45-year-old married woman and the mother of six children, living in the Baray district of Cambodia. To earn a living, she cultivates rice crops, as well as other crops, on her inherited farmland. She has had this business for years. Besides her farming work, Mrs. Peng also takes some time to raise piglets in her backyard. Typically, she is able to yield a profit of 4 USD per day, and she tries hard to support her family, especially her two school-age children. Mrs. Peng wants to use this loan to buy a stock of cashews from her neighbor’s farmland. She hopes that this project will provide her with a good income and improve her living.

loans.use: to buy a stock of cashews from her neighbor’s farmland.

loans.name: José Werner

texts.es: José Werner de 46 años de edad, vive  en casa familiar junto con su esposa e hijo. José es muy trabajador, responsable y dedicado. Para José lo más importante es su familia y es por ella que trabaja duramente para poder llevar el pan de cada día al hogar. Él se dedica a la venta de detergentes como: lejía, desinfectante, suavizador, etc. Tiene muchos años de dedicarse al negocio por lo que ya cuenta con muchos clientes fijos. Además muchas personas la prefieren ya que él siempre está pendiente de mantener satisfechos a los clientes ya que sabe que todo depende de ellos. Su sueño es ver florecer su negocio con el fin de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia. Es por esta razón que solicita este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su negocio en la compra variedad de detergentes como: lejía, desinfectante, suavizador, etc. de tal manera que pueda cubrir una mayor demanda que le permita mejorar sus niveles de venta como de ingresos y por consecuencia mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: José Werner, age 46, lives with his wife and their son in the family home. The most important thing in José's life is his family, and it is for them that he works hard to bring home the daily bread. He sells detergents, including bleach, disinfectant, fabric softener, etc. He has been running this business for many years and has many regular clients. Many people prefer to buy from him because he makes sure his customers are satisfied - he knows, after all, that the business depends on them. His dream is to see his business grow and blossom, with the aim of improving his family's quality of life. For this reason, he is seeking a loan with INTEGRAL to invest in the business by buying a variety of detergents, so that he can expand and increase his sales, his income, and ultimately his family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy bleach, disinfectant, fabric softener, etc

loans.name: Vumilia A Women Group

texts.en:
Jane is the facilitator of the Vumilia A Women group. Jane and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Jane and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Jane takes care of seven children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough to secure food for her family and to access fertilizers and hybrid seeds. With income from maize sales, Jane will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing and put aside savings for future use.

In 2012, the members of Vumilia A Women group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

The photograph shows Jane with her group members and standing on the far left is the field officer.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Savan

texts.en: Savan, 34, is married and resides with her husband in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. She sells groceries, and her husband is a motor-taxi driver and a construction worker. Savan is requesting a loan of USD 1100 to purchase more groceries to stock the store. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner. Savan appears in the photograph with her husband.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to stock the store

loans.name: Rani's Group

texts.en:
Rani has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband, who is a scrap dealer. He purchases scrap from different factories at low rates and sells it at a profitable price to different clients and also to other scrap dealers.

Rani's husband is very good in his dealings with customers and his customers trust his good quality services.  Due to his good nature and professional business dealings, he receives a good number of orders every month.

Rani is a seamstress and sews clothes for her neighboring clients.  She is very skilful and receives regular orders which earns her a reasonable income and helps her pay her utility bills.

She has given birth to five sons. Her eldest son is studying in the second class while the others are illiterate.

Rani has a lot of confidence in her husband and she is very sure that a loan investment will be a productive one for him and will increase his income.

loans.use: to buy scrap for her husband's scrap selling business.

loans.name: Eng

texts.en: Eng, 57, is married and resides with his wife in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. He is a motor-taxi driver, and is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a new motorbike to help him operate his business more efficiently. This will be his first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike to help him operate his business more efficiently.

loans.name: Luisito

texts.en:
Luisito is from Santo Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. He is 33 years old. Luisito is married and has one school-aged child.

To make a living, Luisito owns and operates a bicycle transport service. (A bicycle, also known as a bike, pushbike, or cycle, is a human-powered, pedal-driven, single-track vehicle, having two wheels attached to a frame, one behind the other.) Luisito has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately PHP 1,000 a month for these activities.

Luisito is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000, which will be used to purchase spare parts for his bicycle.
