loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Chibuto, Província de Gaza, Sul de Moçambique, casada e mãe de 4  filhos todos frequentam a Escola. Fez a 7ª classe e parou por falta de condições financeiras pela parte dos pais. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta mais uma sobrinha que vive com ela. 

Saiu de Gaza para o Distrito de Boane quando casou, é domestica e apenas gere o salario do marido ha mais de 15 anos que tem um salario de 5.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria(BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimos noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amigo que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 24.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para dar continuidade a obra do murro da sua casa(areia, cimento, pedra,blocos  e outros).
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende terminar a obra da sua casa e comprar uma viatura para transportar a sua familia, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Fatima was born in the Chibuto district, Gaza Province, in Southern Mozambique.  She is married and has 4 children, all of whom attend school.  She completed school through the 7th grade but dropped out due to her parents' financial situation.  She owns the home where she lives with her family and she also supports a nephew who lives with her.  

She left Gaza for the Boane district when she got married.  She is a housekeeper and only her husband earns a salary. His monthly salary has been 5.000.00mt for over 15 years, which they use for household expenses and savings in their bank account (BIM).  Fatima has never had a loan with another bank and learned about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client.  

This is her second loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 24.000.00mt, which she will use to purchase construction materials to continue building the wall of her home (sand, cement, stones, concrete block, etc.)  She promises to make her payments on time and in the future hopes to finish construction and purchase a vehicle to transport her family.  She plans to request additional loans from Hluvuku for that purpose.

loans.use: to purchase materials to continue construction on the wall of her home (sand, cement, stones, concrete block, etc.)

loans.name: José

texts.es:
El Sr. José es de Ciudad del Este, tiene 3 hijos, quienes aun están en la escuela. Nos comenta que tiene una pequeña carpintería hace más de tres años, cuya producción y venta cada vez más está en ascenso, generándole un buen ingreso.
Comenta que su esposa siempre lo ayuda en la administración de su negocio. Gracias a la buena calidad de sus obras es que cada día tiene más clientes. Hoy día él es un microempresario exitoso con una clientela fiel y numerosa.
El tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante, es por ello que solicita el crédito para la compra de maderas terciadas para abastecer su carpintería.
texts.en: Jose is from Ciudad del Este, he has three children, who are still in school.  He's had a small carpentry shop for more than three years, production and sales continue to increase, generating good income for him.  He mentions that his wife helps him with the management of the business.  Thanks to the good quality of his products, he continues to have more clients.  Now he is a successful micro-entrepreneur with a loyal and growing client base.  He really wants to get ahead and requests a loan to buy plywood to supply his shop.

loans.use: to buy plywood for his shop.

loans.name: Bokholi Core Group

texts.en:
Thomas is the facilitator of the Bokholi Core group. Thomas and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Thomas and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Thomas takes care of nine children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food to ensure food security for his family and to access fertilizers and hybrid seeds. In the recent 2011 season, Thomas had a very good maize yield, harvesting 10 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Thomas was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With income from maize sales, Thomas will construct a new building for the church and save for future use.

In 2012, the members of Bokholi Core group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

The photograph shows Thomas with his group members, and the person standing on the far left is the field officer.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Stellah

texts.en:
Stellah is married and blessed with three school aged children.  

She has been selling shoes for the last three years to support her family.  Stellah also does farming to supplement her income.  She has employed one person to assist her. 

Stellah has been able to retain her business because of her good reputation with her customers.  Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to access loans to boost her business. 

In the next 5 years, she wants to expand her business. With 30,000 Kenya shillings, she wants to buy leather shoes to resale.

loans.use: to buy leather shoes to resale.

loans.name: Wehoya Group

texts.en:
Receive greetings from Wehoya Group in Western Kenya! It is headed by Henry as the group's facilitator. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

 Henry takes care of five children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Henry had a very good maize yield, harvesting 9 bags on 1/2 an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Henry was only able to harvest 4 bags of maize on 1/2 an acre of land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Henry and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

With income from maize sales, Henry will educate his children and save for future use.

In 2012, the members of Wehoya group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize. 

Henry is pictured with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Richard

texts.es:
El Sr. Richard tiene 20 años de edad, es soltero actualmente vive con su madre en la ciudad de Caaguazú.
Richard tiene una despensa, aproximadamente desde el año 2009. El comenzó administrando lo que fue el negocio de su madre, y cuando ya era mayor de edad le dejo el manejo a Richard. Con esfuerzo y sacrificio el negocio logró tener una gran clientela, y en la actualidad Él realizó algunas reformas de la infraestructura para lograr tener mas éxito en su local comercial.
Solicita este préstamo para comprar artículos de primera necesidad para ofrecer mayor variedad de productos y asi satisfacer las demandas de sus clientes, esos productos consisten en comestibles, bebidas, lacteos y demás.
texts.en: Richard is 20 years old, he is single and lives with his mom in the city of Caaguazu.  Richard has a convenience store, he's had it since 2009.  He begun by helping in the administration of his mother's business and when he became of age she gave it to Raul to manage.  With effort and sacrifice the business reached to a wide client base and now he has done some renovations to have more success at the store.  He requests a loan to buy basic need items to offer a variety of products and satisfy the demand from his clients, these items include food, drinks, dairy and other.

loans.use: to buy food, drinks, dairy and other basic products for his convenience store.

loans.name: Samaladou

texts.fr:
Samaladou est une femme  âgé(e) de 43ans. Elle est mariée å un  marin. Elle a 03 enfants tous scolarisés. L’ainé a 18ans et le dernier 14ans.
Samaladou travaille comme revendeuse de produits d’alimentation générale depuis 2006. Elle vend seule à la maison et achète les produits à Lomé.
Samaladou a requis son premier  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits d’alimentations générales. Elle veut intensifier l’activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Samaladou voudrait agrandir l’activité en vue de créer une plus large clientèle. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit assurer les besoins vitaux de la famille.
texts.en:
Samaladou is 43 years old and married to a sailor. The couple have 3 children, aged between 14 and 18, who all go to school. Samaladou has been selling groceries since 2006. She gets her supplies in Lomé and resells them from her home.

Samaladou is requesting her first loan from WAGES in order to restock on groceries and increase her current level of business activity. In the coming years, she would like to expand her business and grow her customer base. She plans to use her profits to take care of her family´s basic needs.

loans.use: to buy groceries for resale.

loans.name: Domitila

texts.en:
Domitila is married and blessed with three children who are in school. 

For the last year, she has been selling herbal medicine to support her family.  She also does farming to increase her income. 

In the next 5 years, she plans to open another outlet of her business. 

Domitila dreams of becoming more financially stable. She has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy herbal medicine for resale.

loans.use: to buy herbal medicine for resale.

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem is a seamstress and loves to sew clothes. She charges 150 rupees per cloth and earns a reasonable amount of income every month, which helps her manage her household expenses.

Her husband operates a motorbike rental business.  He gives bikes to his clients for specific periods of time and charges on a per hour basis.

Naseem is the mother of 3 sons and 2 daughters. Her eldest son is 20 years of age and has a job; the others remain at home.

She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah because her husband wants to buy another motorbike, that will allow him to provide better motorbike rental services to his customers.  This should increase his profits.

He has operated his business for 2 years and Naseem is very confident that a loan will help him establish in his business.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for motorbike rental business.

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
This is Eric, 40, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Medeline, a housewife and mother to their three children. Eric, together with his wife, manages their household while operating the business. He works hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Eric maintains a tricycle business. He owns and drives one tricycle (motorcycle with sidecar) that carries up to four passengers. He starts working as early as 5 in the morning and goes until 11 in the evening. There are times when he drives into the wee hours to increase profit. His regular customers are neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of Php300 every day.

To help him continue business operations he is requesting a loan of Php10,000. He will use the loan to buy motorcycle parts for the maintenance of his tricycle. He has to maintain it in good condition to have a regular income for the daily needs of his family. 

Eric hopes to buy another tricycle and to support his children's schooling up to college level. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of his tricycle

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is a single, 23 year old woman.  She sells clothes to make a living and employs two people to assist her. 

Pauline has been able to retain her business because of her good reputation with her customers.  She has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy skirts, blouses and trousers for resale. 

In the next 5 years, she wants to open another outlet for her business. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been in training to learn more about business opportunities.

loans.use: to buy skirts, blouses and trousers.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph works hard to provide for his family.  He is 43 years of age, married and have four children.  Aside from farming business, he also raises hogs.  Joseph has been a farmer for ten years.

Joesph has a happy family, which inspires him to work hard.  He is in affect father and mother to his children because his wife is an OFW (Overseas Filipino Workers).   

Joseph plans to increase his rice crop yield, to further improve their living conditions. 

But he is sad, because of the high cost of basic commodities which he needs to buy.  For this reason, he is asking for a loan of P30,000 to buy farm inputs to make his rice grow.  Joseph also prays that he could save some for emergency purposes.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs for agricultural business.

loans.name: Katima

texts.fr:
Katima est une femme  âgé(e) de 34 ans. Elle est mariée å un  déclarant en douane. Elle a 02 enfants, 01 scolarisé. Le premier a 06 ans et le dernier a 03ans.
Katima travaille comme revendeuse de charbons  de bois (combustible utilisé dans la cuisine)depuis 2005. Elle vend seule à la maison et achète à Lomé.
Katima a requis son troisième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter plus de charbons de bois. Elle veut diversifier l’activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Katima voudrait agrandir son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit assurer les besoins vitaux de la famille.
texts.en:
Katima is 34 years old. She is married to a customs officer. The couple have 2 children, aged 3 and 6. The eldest child attends school. Since 2005, Katima has been selling charcoal for use in kitchens. She gets her supplies in Lomé and resells them from her home.

Katima is requesting her 3rd loan from WAGES in order to restock on charcoal. In the coming years, she would like to diversify her activities and expand her business. She plans to use her profits to take care of her family´s basic needs.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
This is Zenaida, age 56, a resident of the Silang municipality in Cavite Province in the Philippines. She is married to Rodante, a farmer, and she has four children. She and her husband manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Zenaida operates a pineapple farm. She grows pineapples and some bananas in their farm located in Cavite Province. The farm is in the highlands, where it is suitable to grow pineapples and bananas. She sells her product to markets and fruit stores that she regularly supplies, as well as to the local community. She earns a minimum of 7,000 PHP in monthly sales.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. She will be using the loan to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies for her business. Part of the loan will go to the maintenance of her farm. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Zenaida dreams of being able to give her children a good, high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, allowing her to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, to build social capital, and to repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies for her business.

loans.name: Fadi

texts.en: Fadi, 23, patches olive wood to resell, and to improve his income also raises sheep whose products he sells. Fadi wants to increase his number of sheep and so is requesting a loan for $2,000 from FATEN. The loan will help increase his income and hence his living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase sheep.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a 38-year-old married woman.  She sells cereals including rice, beans, onions, maize and green grams.  She works next to a busy supermarket in the open air with the aid of her car trunk.  

Prior to selling cereals, she sold clothes. Florence has been able to retain her business because of her good reputation with her customers. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy maize and rice for resale. In the next 5 years, she wants to expand her business by having other outlets. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to be more accountable.

loans.use: to buy maize and rice.

loans.name: Saliou

texts.fr: Monsieur Saliou est marié et âgé de 51ans. Il vit au Sénégal dans l’une de ses communautés villageoises. Il s’active depuis plus de 25 ans dans le commerce c'est-à-dire la vente de téléphones portables et d’accessoires. Il pratique aussi la   réparation de téléphones portables.  C’est un passionné  de son activité. A travers ses revenus il gère deux familles. Il est sociétaire du guichet de l’U-IMCEC de la localité ou il habite. Il a déjà remboursé un prêt antérieur. Il sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de cartes téléphoniques et d’accessoires  de téléphones portables qui seront destinés a la vente. Son objectif est  de  renforcer  son local  pour mieux développer et rentabiliser son  activité de commerce. Ce financement lui permettra d’accroitre ses revenus pour pouvoir maintenir la bonne gestion de ses charges familiales.
texts.en:
Mr. Saliou is married and 51 years old. He lives in Senegal in one of its village communities.

He has been active for over 25 years in retail trading, in particular the sales of mobile phones and accessories. He also repairs mobile phones. He is passionate about his business, and his income allows him two support two families.

He is member of the branch office of U-IMCEC of the locality where he lives. He has already repaid a previous loan, and is now requesting a loan of 300,000 francs destined to purchase phone cards and accessories for mobile phones for resale.

He aims to build up his workshop so he can better develop and maximise the returns from his trade activity. This funding will allow him to increase his income so he can continue to properly assume his family responsibilities.

loans.use:
achat de crtes téléphoniques et d'accessoires de téléphones portables a revendre.
buy telephone cards and mobile phone accessories for resale.

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr:
Kossi est un homme âgé de 44 ans. Il est marié à une coiffeuse et a 01 enfant de 12ans scolarisé.
Kossi travaille comme imprimeur depuis 2007. Il travaille seul et achète les outils de travail à Lomé.
Kossi a requis son second crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des machines d’imprimerie. Il veut réinvestir dans l’activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Kossi voudrait agrandir son activité. Il dit qu’avec les profits, Il prévoit avoir une famille heureuse.
texts.en: Kossi is a 44-year-old man. He is married to a hair stylist and has a 12-year-old child who attends school. Kossi has been working as a printer since 2007. He works alone and buys tools in Lome. Kossi needed a second loan from WAGES in order to buy printing machines. He wants to reinvest in the business. In the coming years, Kossi would like to grow his business. He says that with the profits, he foresees having a happy family.

loans.use: to buy printing machines

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr:
AMINATA HABITE DANS UN DÉPARTEMENT DE LA RÉGION SUD DU SÉNÉGAL ÂGÉE DE 35 ANS ,ELLE EST MARIÉE ET A DEUX ENFANTS QUI SONT TOUS A L'ÉCOLE FRANÇAISE EN CLASSE DE CI ET DE CP .
AMINATA FAIT LE COMMERCE DE POISSON DEPUIS 2005 ELLE FAIT SES ACHATS  a partir d'un village  environnant AU NORD DE SA LOCALITÉ POUR VENIR VENDRE DANS LE MARCHE LOCAL DE LA VILLE 
AMINATA DÉMARRE SA JOURNÉE A PARTIR DE 7 HEURE A 11 HEURE . AVEC SON COMMERCE ELLE SOUTIENT SON MARI SUR LES DÉPENSES DE LA FAMILLE . 
AMINATA SOUHAITERAIS AVEC SON COMMERCE AVOIR SON PROPRE TERRAIN ET LE CONSTRUIRE ,POUR L'AVENIR DE SES ENFANTS .
texts.en:
Aminata is 35 years old and lives in southern Senegal. She is married and has 2 children who are both in elementary classes (CI and CP) at the French school.

Aminata has been selling fish since 2005. She gets her supplies in a village north of her town and resells them at her local village market. Her workdays start at 7 and end at 11, and her income enables her to help her husband with the household expenses.

Aminata would eventually like to be able to use the profits from her business to buy some land and build on it, so that she can provide her children with a good future.

loans.use: acheter du poisson a revendre

loans.name: Khaitgul

texts.ru: Хайтгул умная и целеустремленная женщина, она замужем и любящая мать троих детей. Она занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур. Она выращивает пшеницу, лук, кунжут, кукурузу, морковь, тыкву и рис. Она является владельцем данного бизнеса и ей помогают муж и дети. Она хочет приобрести минеральные удобрения, ГСМ и оплатить труд  работников.  С этой целью Хайтгул запрашивает займ в размере 4500 Сомони.
texts.en: Khaigul is an intelligent and goal-oriented person. She is married and the loving mother of three. She  cultivates crops. She grows wheat, onions, sesame, corn, carrots, pumpkins and rice. She is the owner of this business; her husband and children help her. She would like to buy mineral fertilizers and fuel as well as pay the cost of labor. This is why she is requesting a loan in the amount of 4500

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and fuel as well as  pay the cost of labor.

loans.name: Milele Shg Group

texts.en:
Caleb is the facilitator of the Milele SHG group. Caleb and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Caleb and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Caleb takes care of four children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food to ensure food security for his family and because of One Acre's best prices. In the recent 2011 season, Caleb had a very good maize yield, harvesting 20 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Caleb was only able to harvest 10 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With income from maize sales, Caleb will educate his children and save for future use.

In 2012, the members of Milele SHG group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

The photograph shows Caleb with his group members, and the person standing on the far left is the field officer.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Ceferino

texts.es:
El Sr. Ceferino tiene 41 años de edad, es un hombre  muy trabajador, está acompañado con la Sra. Juana, hace 12 años, tienen tres hijos juntos Juan, Sara y Elias, viven en la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo hace mas de 12 años.
El Sr. Ceferino es Mototaxista hace 5 años, vivía en el campo con sus padres pero decidió ir a vivir en la ciudad pensando en el progreso suyo y el de su familia.
Comenta que su trabajo es muy sacrificado porque en las épocas de invierno tiene que pasar por muchos obstáculos debido a que tiene menos pasajeros porque hace mucho frío. Su sueño es comprar mas motos para trabajar y así progresar cada día mas.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de repuestos para su mototaxi, ya que este es su medio de trabajo y es indispensable para el.
texts.en: Ceferino is 41, he is a very hardworking man, he's been with Juana for 12 years, they have three children; Juan, Sara and Elias, they live in the city of Cornel Oviedo.  Ceferino is a motorbike taxi driver, he has been for five years, he used to live in a rural area with his parents but he decided to move to the city thinking about his future progress and his family's.  he indicates that his job is hard because during winter he has to overcame obstacles due to having less passengers because it's very cold.  His dream is to buy more motorbikes to work and make more progress.  He requests a loan to buy repair parts for his taxi because being the bike his work equipment, it's indispensable for him that it works.

loans.use: to buy repair parts for motorbike taxi.

loans.name: Mulimani C Young Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Mulimani C Young Group in Western Kenya! Diana is the facilitator of the Mulimani C Young group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Diana takes care of seven children at home. She joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund's best prices and in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, she had a good maize yield, harvesting 10 1/2 bags on 3/4 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Diana was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on 3/4 acre of land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Diana and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

With income from maize sales, Diana will ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.

 In 2012, the members of Mulimani C Young group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

Diana is pictured with her group members in the photograph.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Bonface

texts.en: Bonface is married and blessed with two children and one of them is in school. For the last five years, he has been running Madukani Cereals, a general store that sells products such as cereals, bathing soap, washing soap and other household products, in order to support his family. He is also employed to earn extra income. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings in order to buy maize, beans, rice and peas and other products to resell. In the next five years, he wants to expand his business and convert his shop into a company. Bonface expresses gratitude to Kiva partner Faulu Kenya, since he has been able to access a loan to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy maize, beans, rice and peas and other products to sell.

loans.name: Essi

texts.fr:
Essi est une femme âgé(e) de 29 ans. Elle est célibataire et n’a pas d’enfants.  
Essi travaille comme revendeuse de garnitures et des mèches depuis 2005. Elle vend dans une boutique  à ses clients. Elle achète les produits à Lomé et sa difficulté est la concurrence sur le marché.
Essi a requis son second crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des garnitures et des mèches. Elle veut réinvestir dans son activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Essi voudrait agrandir en ouvrant d’autres points de vente. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit avoir une famille heureuse et intervenir dans l’éducation de ses frères et sœurs.
texts.en: Essi is a 29-year-old woman. She is single and has no children. Essi works as a merchant of accessories and hair extensions. She sells to her clients in a store. She buys the products in Lomé and has difficulty with competition at the market. Essi has asked for a second loan from WAGES to buy accessories and hair extensions. She wants to reinvest in her business. In the coming years, Essi would like to grow her business by opening other selling locations. She says that with her profits, she foresees having a happy family and to help with the education of her brothers and sisters.

loans.use: Acheter des garnitures et des méches

loans.name: Cidalia

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Matutuine, Província de Maputo, Sul de Moçambique, viuva e mãe de 7  filhos todos maiores de idade. Nunca te oportunidade de estudar porque os pais nao a deixaram quando era crianca. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta mais um neto que vive com ela. 

Saiu de Matutuine para o Distrito de Boane quando casou, é negociante dedica-se a venda de produtos diversos ha mais de 20 anos e tem um rendimento de cerca de 3.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria(BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimos noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amigo que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu sexto emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para dar continuidade a obra  da sua casa(ferro, areia, cimento, pedra,blocos  e outros).Os primeiros emprestimos foram de: 6.000.00mt, 7.000.00mt, 10.000.00mt, 12.000.00mt, e 15.000.00mt,para o negocio e habitação.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende terminar a obra da sua casa e ampliar o seu negocio construindo um estabelecimento comercial, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Cidalia was born in the Matutuine district, Maputo Province, in southern Mozambique.  She is a widow and has 7 children who are all grown. She never had the opportunity to attend school because her parents did not allow her to attend when she was a child.  She owns the home where she lives with her family and she also supports a grandson who lives with her.   

She left Matutuine for the Boane district when she got married.  She is a merchant and has sold a variety of products for over 20 years.  She earns around 3.000.00mt per month, which she uses for household expenses and savings in her bank account (BIM).

She has never had a loan with other banks.  She learned about Hluvuku from a friend who is also a client.  This is her sixth loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 20.000.00mt, which she plans to use to purchase construction materials to continue building her home (iron, sand, cement, stones, concrete block, etc.).  The prior loans were for 6.000.00mt, 7.000.00mt, 10.000.00mt, 12.000.00mt, and 15.000.00mt, for her business and housing.  

She promises to make her payments on time.  In the future she plans to finish construction on her home and to expand her business by building a shop.  She plans to request additional loans from Hluvuku for these purposes.

loans.use: to purchase materials to continue construction on her home (iron, sand, cement, stones, concrete block, etc.)

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys is a hardworking business woman aged 27 years-old. She is married and blessed with three children all of whom attend  school. She has been practicing dairy farming for the last three years in order to support her family. She has employed one person to assist her to manage the business. Gladys has been able to retain her business because of a good reputation with her customers. With 40,000 Kenyan shillings, she intends to buy animal feed. In the next five years, she wants to expand her business and have many cows. Gladys expresses gratitude to Kiva partner Faulu Kenya for training her on good customer care.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Kholboy

texts.ru: Холбой трудолюбивый, порядочный человек. Он отец пятерых детей. Жена помогает в бизнесе. Он владелец небольшого  земельного участка. На участке он выращивает сельхозкультуры. Земля приносит хороший доход, но и требует большого внимания и труда. Он хочет улучшить свои бытовые условия. На земле он в следующем году хочет вырастить урожай пшеницы, арбуза и кукурузы. Для этого следует хорошо подготовить землю к весеннему посеву. Он хочет получить займ для приобретения минеральных удобрений и ГСМ. Он надеется на помощь добрых людей и с нетерпением ждет одобрения займа. Он заранее благодарен за поддержку
texts.en: Kholboy is a hardworking and decent man. He is a father of five children. His wife helps him in this business. He is an owner of a small plot of land. On this plot he grows crops. The land gives good income, but also demands a lot of attention and labor. He wants to improve his living conditions. Next year he wants to grow crops of wheat, corn and watermelon. He needs to prepare the land well for the spring sowing. Kholboy wants to take out a loan to buy mineral fertilizer and POL. He hopes for the help of kind people and is looking forward to the loan approval. Kholboy is thanking in advance for the support.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizer and POL.

loans.name: Didjao

texts.fr:
Didjao est une femme  âgé(e) de 34 ans. Elle est mariée  å un  commerçant. Elle a 02 enfants, dont 01 scolarisé. Le premier a 06ans  ans et le dernier a 1an6mois. 
Didjao travaille comme revendeuse d’ignames depuis 2008. Elle vend de façon ambulante. 
Didjao a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des ignames. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Didjao voudrait rendre l’activité durable. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit s’occuper de l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en: Didjao is a 34-year-old woman. She is a married merchant. She has two children, one of whom attends school. The first is 6 and the second one is a year and 6 months. Didjao has been selling yams since 2008. She sells from place to place. Didjao has asked for her first loan from WAGES to buy yams. She wants to reinvest in her business. In the coming years, Didjao would like to continue her business. She says that with the profits, she foresees paying for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy yams

loans.name: Vache

texts.en: Vache is a young farmer from Kapan. He keeps livestock and beehives. Unable to cover the family's daily expenses with current income, Vache has applied for a loan to develop his business. With the requetsed loan, Vache plans to purchase livestock and forage. This loan will help Vache to expand his farm and earn additional income. This is essential for Vache and his family as the increased income will allow him to renovate their house and ensure a prosperous life for his own family in the future. Vache lives with his parents.

loans.use: to pay for livestock and forage.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en: Hellen is married and blessed with three children who are in school. She describes herself as a hardworking businesswoman. She plants tree seedlings for sale — a business she has been running for the last eleven years to support her family. In the next 5 years, she plans to open another outlet of her business. Hellen dreams of buying a piece of land in the future. She has requested a loan of 30,000 KES to buy tree seeds. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has become more business-oriented.

loans.use: to buy tree seeds.

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr:
Mme Awa est une jeune couturière de 36 ans. Elle est mariée et s’active dans le domaine depuis tout juste un an. Elle a fait ses débuts dans le commerce et continue à  l’allier  avec la couture : confection-vente.
Avec l’argent du prêt Awa aimerai acheter une machine cornière  et une Vi pour pouvoir satisfaire la demande.
Avec les bénéfices, elle améliore petit à petit la qualité de son service.
texts.en:
Awa is a 36 years old and married. She is a seamstress and has been sewing for a year. She is just starting in business and plans to use her sewing skills to build a business manufacturing and selling clothes.

Awa will use the loan to buy an embroidery sewing machine so that she can better satisfy customer demand. She is using the profits from her business to gradually improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Moamba, Província de Maputo, Sul de Moçambique, viuva e mãe de 5  filhos dos quais 2 maiores de idade e 3 ainda frequentam a Escola. Fez a 4ª classe e parou por falta de condições financeiras pela parte dos pais. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta mais 4 netos que vivem com ela. 

Saiu de Moamba para o Distrito de Boane quando se juntou com se marido, é negociante dedica-se a venda de produtos de primeira necessidade ha mais de 2 anos e tem um rendimento de cerca de 4.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria(BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimos noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amigo que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 17.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para dar continuidade a obra  da sua casa(chapas, reia, cimento, pedra,blocos  e outros).
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende terminar a obra da sua casa e mobiliar, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Violeta was born in the district of Moamba, Maputo province in Southern Mozambique.  She is widowed and has 5 children, 2 who are adults and 3 who are in school.  She attended school through the 4th grade but did not finish because her parents did not have the financial resources.  She owns the home where she lives with her family and she also supports 4 grandchildren who live with her. 

She left Moamba for the Boane district when she married her husband.  She is a merchant and for the past 2 years has had a business selling basic needs items.  She earns around 4.000.00mt per month, which she uses for household expenses and savings in her bank account (BIM).

Violeta has never had a loan in another bank.  She learned about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client.  This is her first loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 17.000.00mt, which she will use to purchase construction materials to continue work on her home (metal panels, sand, cement, stones, concrete block, etc.). 

She promises to make payments as scheduled.  In the future she plans to finish construction on her home and furnish it, and for that purpose she will request additional loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase construction material to continue work on her home (metal panels, sand, cement, stones, concrete block, etc.)

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a hardworking business woman, aged 41. She is married and blessed with three children who are in school. For the last year, she has been selling herbal medicine to make a living. She also does farming to supplement her income. In the next 5 years, she plans to expand her business. 

Since Mary joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to access loans to boost her business. She is requesting for a loan of 10,000 Kenya shillings to buy herbal medicine for resale.

loans.use: to buy herbal medicine.

loans.name: Costa San Antonio Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formo a través D. la Sra. Asteria, quien se había acercado hasta la Oficina D. la Fundación Paraguaya para saber más del Programa D. Comité D. Mujeres Emprendedoras, ella invito a sus amigas y compañeras del Barrio y decidieron sumarse al trabajo grupal para salir adelante y así mejorar su estilo D. vida, son 17 mujeres trabajadoras y humildes que deben ganarse el sustento todos los días.
La señora Asteria es una D. las integrantes del grupo, nos comenta que gracias a la venta D. leche, ella ha podido salir adelante, cubrir sus gastos y ayudar a su familia para el sustento diario. Ella se define como una mujer muy trabajadora y sacrificada, que diariamente se desvive por darle lo mejor a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para abastecerse D. leche, pues no quiere quedarse sin stock. Agradece a la fundación por la oportunidad que le da.
texts.en:
This committee was formed by Asteria who approached Fundación Paraguaya's office to find out more about the Entrepreneurial Women's Committee Program.  She invited her friends and acquaintances from her neighborhood and they decided to start working together as a group so that they could get ahead and improve their lifestyles.  They are 17 hard-working, humble women who must earn a living every day.

Asteria is one of the group's members.  She tells us that, thanks to her milk sales, she has been able to get ahead, cover her expenses and help proviD. for her family on a daily basis.  She describes herself as a very hard-working and selfless woman who goes out of her way to proviD. her family with the best.

Asteria is requesting a loan to stock her business with milk as she doesn't want to be left without stock.  She is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity that they are giving her.

loans.use: to buy milk to re-sell

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en: Nicholas is a hardworking business man, aged 62. He is married and blessed with six children. He has been running a retail shop business for the last twelve years to support his family. He also practices dairy farming to supplement his income. He is requesting for a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy sugar, rice and bread for resale. In the next 5 years, he plans to manage a supermarket business. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has become more financially stable.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice and bread.

loans.name: Gracieta

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Província de Maputo, Sul de Moçambique, separada e mãe de 2  filhos todos frequentam a Escola. Fez a 8ª classe e parou por falta de condições financeiras pela parte dos pais. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e as vezes tem ajudado a mãe enviando dinheiro para dispesas alimentares. 

É negociante dedica-se a venda de roupa usada ha mais de 2 anos e tem um rendimento de cerca de 8.500.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria(BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimos noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amigo que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 25.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar fardos de roupa para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.O primeiro emprestimo foi de: 20.000.00mt, para o negocio. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende melhorar as condições da sua casa, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Gracieta was born in the Boane district, Maputo province, in southern Mozambique.  She is separated and has 2 children who are in school.  She attended school through the 8th grade but did not continue due to her parents’ financial situation.  She lives in her own home with her family and sometimes helps out her mother by sending her money for food expenses.  

Gracieta is a merchant and has sold used clothes for the past 2 years with a monthly income of around 8.500.000mt, which she uses for household expenses and savings in her bank account (BIM).  She has never had a loan in other banks.  She learned about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client.  This is her second loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 25.000.00mt, which she will use to purchase bundles of clothing to increase her inventory.  The first loan was for 20.000.00mt, for her business.  

She promises to make her payments on schedule.  In the future she plans to improve the condition of her home and she will request additional loans from Hluvuku for that purpose.

loans.use: to purchase used clothing for resale.

loans.name: Mbaye

texts.fr:
MBAYE HABITE DANS LA RÉGION SUD DU SÉNÉGAL AGE DE 32 ANS MARIE D'UNE FEMME ET ONT UN ENFANT AGE D'UN AN 
MBAYE EST COMMERÇANT DEPUIS 1992 FAIT LE COMMERCE DE TÉLÉPHONE PORTABLE ET ACCESSOIRES ,RADIOS ETC...
IL FAIT SES ACHATS DE MARCHANDISES A DAKAR .                                                                   MBAYE A CHOISI LE MÉTIER DE COMMERCE PARCE QUE A L'ÉCOLE ÇA NE MARCHAIT PAS .AVEC SON COMMERCE IL A EUT DEUX TERRAINS QU'IL SOUHAITE CONSTRUIRE DANS L'AVENIR POUR LES METTRE EN LOCATION .
texts.en:
Mbaye is 32 years old and lives in southern Senegal. He is married and the couple have a one-year-old child. Mbaye has been a salesman since 1992 and sells electronic goods like mobile phones and accessories, and radios. He buys his merchandise in Dakar.

Mbaye decided to become a salesman because school wasn´t working out for him, and his business has already enable him to buy 2 plots of land. He eventualL. plans to build properties on his land to rent out.

loans.use: to restock on electronic goods for resale.

loans.name: Anne

texts.en: Anne is a single woman aged 24. She has been selling clothes to make a living. The major challenge she faces is competition. Anne has been able to retain her business because of good reputation with her customers. She has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy blouses and belts for resale. In the next 5 years, she wants to expand her business. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has been able to manage her business with the previous loan.

loans.use: To buy blouses and belts.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is a single woman aged 30. She has been selling clothes to earn a living. Her business is very competitive due to the quality of her products. She has a reliable customer base. Her potential customers are the local residents. She is requesting for a loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings to buy shirts and blouses for resale. In the next five years, she plans to establish a wholesale business. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has been able to adopt the culture of saving.

loans.use: To buy shirts and blouses for resale.

loans.name: Zulfa

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Província de Maputo, Sul de Moçambique, casada e mãe de 4  filhos dos 3 ja tem os seus lares e 1 ainda frequenta a Escola. Fez a 4ª classe e parou por falta de condições financeiras pela parte dos pais. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta seu neto que vive com ela.

É negociante dedica-se a venda de roupa usada ha mais de 4 anos e tem um rendimento de cerca de 6.500.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria(BIM).
Já teve emprestimos noutros bancos(GGLS) a bastante tempo e pagou sem dificuldades, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amigo que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu quarto emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 25.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar fardos de roupa para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.Os primeiros emprestimos foram de: 9.000.00mt, 15.000.00mt, e 20.000.00mt, para o negocio. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende melhorar construir um estabelecimento comercial onde possa expor o seu produto, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Zulfa was born in the Boane district, Maputo province, in southern Mozambique.  She is married and has 4 children.  Three of them have their own homes and 1 is still in school.  She attended school through the 4th grade but dropped out due to her parents' financial situation.  She lives in her own home with her family and also supports a grandson who lives with her.  

Zulfa is a merchant and has had a business selling used clothes for more than 4 years.  She earns around 6.500.00mt monthly, which she uses for household expenses and savings in her bank account (BIM).

She has had prior loans in other banks (GGLS) a long time ago and she paid them without any problems.  She learned about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client.  This is her fourth loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 25.000.00mt, which she plans to use to purchase bundles of clothing to increase her stock.  The prior loans were for 9.000.00mt, 15.000.00mt, and 20.000.00mt, all for her business.  She promises to make her payments on schedule.  In the future she plans to build a shop where she can display her products, and for that purpose she intends to request additional loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase used clothing for resale.
